Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine and coffee.

pGJpBHQ5TxJTaFiNICrGxg.text: This is one of my favorites always good.  I usually rate based on food, service and environment and to get a 5 star review you must be amazing.  This place dose an amazing job on all the above.  Best place for breakfast in AZ.   Staff always kind and best atmosphere.    Enjoy.

mUk3hPE0B98eaboSMyUfWw.text: First time at Luci's here in Phoenix and service was EXCELLENT. When we got there they were closing their kitchen and I have a son who was so dead set on pancakes ( he also is extremely picky). They so graciously allowed me to by 2 kid flapjacks no questions asked. I didnt have to plead and explain how my son won't eat anything else, they just said yes. Also the pancakes were delicious !!! Thank you guys, you really made my sons night!!

oi5MxVW-ywJNkfiVZ7Zhow.text: The food was good but a little pricey.  The ambiance is worth the price.  The kids had a great time playing in the fountains.

gRZJqzcV3SNUqP6o6WYAvA.text: Meh. The food was decent. I'm gonna spend 60 bucks on breakfast I want a server. I'm spoiled I know but I live in the area and a restaurant really has to bring it's A game in this part of town. I'll go back but but for just coffee.

JaeALPHbmmhUdvQFfTKm8g.text: I usually love coming to Luci's and assumed they had high standards for healthy food. Unfortunately I went in last Monday (3/25) and asked for the breakfast sandwich on Gluten Free bread with turkey. The guy working the register assured me they did have gluten free bread and I made sure to double check when he rang in my order. I then received my sandwich and the bread looked distinctly not gluten free (I've been eating it for 11+ years) so I asked the lady who was directing the orders/kitchen/food running to confirm the bread was gluten free. She glanced at it and said 'yes'.   Clearly, as I am now on DAY NINE of feeling like crap, painful and bloated, and have the usual symptoms of gluten attack, the bread was NOT gluten free and I am extremely upset that their management doesn't care enough to make sure the staff knows what is what. Unfortunately there isn't anything I can do to feel better, and I will NEVER be eating here again, I don't normally write reviews but I want to save other GF people from eating here and trusting their food/staff in future.

xMLufo5v4N7Vso4yzfx6gQ.text: Fun place for lunch if you have little ones.  Nice variety of food on the menu. Outside patio with water pad for the kids. Watch out for the pesky birds. This place is the best environment for a relaxed lunch experience

gckkt3BkAgWzfu3muW2ZoQ.text: I thought the food was not the best here. I got the avocado toast. The toast was burnt and the whole meal was so dry and lacked flavor.  This comes with egg whites and I should have asked for sunny side up eggs because the egg whites just add to the blandness.   There is great seating out back and I could see this being a nice place to sit and read a book while drinking sone tea or coffee.

BEvEOvYQb9Fw6We8Ldo5OQ.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in town. The outdoor area feels like an escape from the city. Great place to buy unique gifts, too.

fC-0x11ZafTz9gRCeHYN1g.text: Luci's, I love you... but if I'm gonna pay $11 for an acai bowl, I'd expect it to not be made with motts apple juice and have moldy blueberries on top (didn't get a pic, but I showed the workers). The most disappointing thing is for the amount of money you pay, they don't seem to pay much attention to details.

TyszQ0J0iVmgaztKaQ6r5A.text: This is an enjoyable place to visit and sit outside in their grass and tree covered courtyards. Young moms gather in the mornings w toddlers around the fountains and sometimes a bird in a tree drops their former meal right on your head--plop! It's a real orchard!!! Kidding aside, there is an extensive breakfast menu. I like their egg dishes and even their yogurt parfait. There are yummy muffins and a terrific array of Italian ice creams--what do you call it? Yikes...the name escapes me right now, you know what I mean. Don't you?

to3rWRvEfAnDAyTWPRxKYQ.text: This is my favorite spot in Arizona. The ambiance is great and the food is even better! I love all the greenery and the neighborhood vibe! The staff is always really nice, helpful and gives great service. This place is a perfect date spot, study spot, hang out spot, quick lunch, business meeting, they really cater to everyone! I recommend the corned beef Benny for breakfast or the turkey sandwich for lunch. I am a frequent visitor and they never disappoint!!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I7i6QOY-aoUsUwUvwBxB1w.text: Great place to have a casual meet up. Kid friendly thank goodness!!  I recently went for coffee with a friend. We had a great breakfast. So many Keto or paleo options. I would recommend The orchard. I had none left to post a photo.  Summer heat prompted me to pick a cold caffeinated treat for the road home. Their new Roji tea is amazing. I have not seen a matcha with such great flavor and low calorie. I went back to buy some for my husband. Amazing products at Lucis in addition to their menu!!! You will enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

W-n7H0z7R9v7dbmPHoVNjQ.text: Love the newish location! The space at the original Luci's was a bit crammed, so I love going to this new location. Their outdoor patio is perfect for when the weather is great! I love their lattes and breakfast options here. I usually order the breakfast frittata and avocado toast. You can't go wrong with either option. They also have tasty pastries that are baked daily. One of my favorites that they occasionally have is the blueberry scone, which is to die for! It's a perfect spot for breakfast!

b_o8TPY_uPchdOUmSUxlHw.text: Stopped by this cute little restaurant when I was craving breakfast for dinner one night. Loved the atmosphere and the staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful. Delicious food and coffee!! I highly recommend the Funky Monkey French Toast and a side of potatoes. It is a bit on the pricer side, but for the quality of the food and the taste, it is worth it!! My second time going there, one thing that was a little disappointing and upsetting was when I tried to order the french toast, and the cashier said they stopped serving all food except pizzas after 5pm. I thought that was very weird because online it never said any of that. So then I called the Luci's Healthy Marketplace to see if they were still serving it and they do until closing, so we went there instead. It is definitely one of my favorite restaurants here in the Phoenix valley!!

Gn4wWIfA_I5MABUK5D5kwg.text: Nestled in the heart of Central Phoenix, Luci's at the Orchard is the epitome of an oasis getaway. Large trees and overgrown greenery surround quaint bungalow style buildings creating a serine atmosphere perfect for adults and children alike. Patio seating surrounds a bustling splash pad ideal for littles for all ages. Babies rule the roost here... no shortage of screeching and smiles at Luci's. An adorable ice cream and candy shop sits caddy corner to Pomelo hidden away behind the bar which features mimosas, bloody marys, margaritas, tasty cocktails and an abundance of craft beer selections. No shortage of food options here. Breakfast is served all day, while the lunch menu offers plenty of sandwiches, salad and burger selections. I snagged myself the sweet fig and tuna salad wrap accompanied with a pile of fries and a bottled root beer. Tasty, flavorful and fantastically affordable! Parking is notoriously scares so keep that in mind when arriving on a busy Saturday morning or a Sunday brunch. All in all, I love me some Luci's. Get on board Gilbert, we need a location  too!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet Fig &amp; Tuna Salad Wrap

kqG2lt2Xb7f1XEhA2GeieQ.text: I visited Lucy's at the Orchard for lunch. It was my first visit and I liked the nice backyard to eat outside and the healthy options on the menu. But what I don't understand is why you only have plastic cups? Especially when I dine in I don't see the point to drink out of plastic cups when I'm using a ceramic plate and stainless steel cutlery at the same time. When I asked for a glass I was told that the only non-plastic option is a coffee mug. Seriously? As a restaurant that advertises to provide fresh and locally sourced food why doesn't it go hand in hand with being environmentally friendly?

cr04m2AJqNo6c7OnixPaiA.text: First time here and we loved it ... As parents to small children we are often searching for kid friendly restaurants and this is as good as it gets ! We loved their menu and the atmosphere  Customer service was amazing even considering our large group . I had the frittata and it was reasonably priced and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

s48y2OrRTqta5WQj-mqhNA.text: This place is so cute and very relaxing and peaceful! I went here to study and get some work done and it was a nice atmosphere. Friendly staff! I got an iced vanilla latte and it was delicious. A little pricey compared to other coffee shops I've been to in Phoenix but worth it nonetheless! Will definitely be coming back!

wTattQoBUYa6xlRqve6znA.text: This was the most adorable restaurant. So convenient, homely and the staff was absolutely wonderful. Food is off the carts. Very afforable with huge portions. We can't wait to become regulars here.

B2BnuhoUOwNURixvcKQnDQ.text: This was my first time coming to this place and was excited to show my sisters this new cute place. Unfortunately, I would have gave 5 stars but the customer service by Sam R (cashier) was not pleasant or welcoming. As I heard her take a customers order before me she had an attitude. The lady simply asked if she needed the table number to take with her and she said in a rude tone "yes you need to take the order number" as the costumer walked alway Sam R rolled her eyes. As I walked up to place my order I was not greeted..First and foremost, that is the #1 rule of customer service! Secondly, my sisters order after me and again Sam R had a rude attitude towards them. My suggestion is to properly train this Sam R on customer service. Overall, I will give the food a 5 star!

AdXePD7qeTYYUYjW8PnNrw.text: Amazing atmosphere-- during the day, it's a great place for kids and dogs! Splash pad for the little ones is a great treat! Food was very good-- slightly overpriced, I feel but high quality. At night it's for the romantics with twinkling lights and cozy seating areas! Definitely worth trying!

HKMPbZQqlp0ca3BbZhbkng.text: My new favorite local morning meet up spot. The atmosphere is beautiful and showcases what I love about AZ.

xqrB6SH-oZAAnwQbZB5G6g.text: I love going here to eat with my daughter so she can play outside. The splash pad is fun! The young people working the counter can be a bit short and seem annoyed at times, but other than that, the service is great. If they lowered their drive thru coffee to match dutch brothers I would go there instead for my morning latte. They are currently at least one dollar more.

ioXedYfv0UGtYpjngJT_Dw.text: Loved this place.  Great atmosphere- and the food was really good.  We had the veggie frittata and the chopped Cobb salad.  Both very tasty- only issue was chicken a bit on the dry side.  Drinks were great- can't wait to go back!  Do yourself a favor and go to The Orchard- we need more of this type of place!!

rZ5e5qfDX6B_LAwWrs_o9w.text: Great new location on 12 street north of Glendale on the west side of the road. The place is BRAND NEW and the atmosphere is just awesome. I come here on Thursday mornings after a run with a few friends and the food is pretty darn good. So far the biscuits & gravy with subside egg is just ridiculously delicious.  I also love the chiliquias (probably spelling it wrong), the oatmeal is great and so are the burritos. I do wish the coffee was self serve but it's good also. They have lots of room inside and just a beautiful courtyard outside where we usually sit. They sell lots of little stuff too like Cracker Barrel but not nearly as much, lots of pastries too.

O75II326rAGP-zs2zP__bA.text: A great setting!  Delightful inside and out, with plenty of room and parking;  easy access in a residential area.  Excellent food and coffee.  Great concept.  Can you build one closer to my neighborhood?

hoIXTkFFjiVhQlRvg8xKjA.text: Our family (4 adults and 5 children) met at Luci's at the Orchard on Sunday around noon.  This was our first visit to the Orchard location, and we were not disappointed.  Although the place was busy, service was prompt and the food was excellent. I can personally vouch for the Morning Run Burrito and  Sweet Fig and Tuna Salad Wrap; no complaints.  The kids had a great time as well.  I read some reviews that were critical of the service or displays, but I saw no evidence of shortcomings in our visit.

7WUSRM0FHbPdvPtsNNn4tQ.text: Cant say enough good things about this place, It's our family favorite. First, the location is Beautiful! There is a yard area with tables and chairs for seating, or if you are like us, you can grab a smoothie (very berry, YUM!) or (my personal favorite) an Arnold Palmer and sit on the grass to enjoy your treats. At night it is beautifully lit with lights that really give off an amazing ambiance. Second, there is something here for everyone. We have small kids and it's hard to find a place where you can enjoy some food with kids who feel like poking around and exploring. One of the reasons we love the Orchard so much is how family friendly it is. We can sit at a table and enjoy our food which is always amazing( the monkey french toast, OMG) and adult beverages (they have great draft beers) while our kids play on the splash pad. Aside from the super yummy food and drinks, they property houses Splurge, the Gelato shop. Fresh and amazing Gelato with a variety of toppings. The splurge shop itself is adorable and feels retro with a variety of different candies that I can never resist :) The nights when we are lucky enough to have a babysitter and want to get out by ourselves? We visit Pomelo. The restaurant is gorgeous and chic, the food is amazing,the price is on point and the service is always great. They also have really awesome happy hour specials. We live a short distance from the Orchard and it is exactly what this area needed.  It really is a wonderful place to enjoy delicious things, relax, listen to live music and get to know the community. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We don&#39;t live far so my husband and I  have scooter dates. We ride our scooters down and enjoy the atmosphere over drinks or dinner.

Pjxm973pSy5MZfRb8y6X7A.text: We were anxious to check out the Orchard since it recently opened and it certainly did not disappoint!  I love the original Luci's location, so assumed this one would be just as good...and it sure is!  The staff was very friendly, they have a nice drink and food menu and great seating options both inside and out.  We ordered the club, turkey sandwich and the Oasis juice.  Everything was absolutely delicious!  The fresh juice was quite pricey, but so worth it.

ANXL4c1ugGswnBIt35a-cg.text: Wonderful atmosphere indoors & out! Darling gift shop and ice cream shop.  VERY pricey for some of the same food & beverage you get in this town!  A luncheon club sandwich w/fries, a dessert & tea was over $28! That's quite spendy for this community. It's a great place, food was nice but typical. But at those lunch prices it will not be a regular stop it's more of a special occasion stop for a $30 plus tip lunch. For $30 you could go the The Henry or Hillstone.

p5SD1NQDKQ-3um24xjb3nA.text: Great selection of breakfast items and everything we bought was delicious!  Cute shop, friendly staff!

-kU7tzcPCiy1Bp6OpsrMNA.text: Luci's at the Orchard was outstanding! The staff was amazing, coffee to die for, and atmosphere very welcoming. Although it is hotter than heck out right now the outside seating area is perfect to enjoy cocktails with girlfriends or some coffee. I cannot wait to go back and try their food! 2 thumbs up :)

FQd1P6NMptarsXrtYEdHxQ.text: Orders GF French toast, 2 scrambled eggs and coffee for $15. Very filling and yummy breakfast. Awesome to sit in the courtyard and relax

LrFvyfokZfsGKVw6PSYDdA.text: I ate here a few weeks ago and it was an awesome surprise! The food...I inhaled it. Vaporized it. It's great for family and they have fountains the kiddos can splash and play in. Highly recommend and be ready to be surprised. It really is nicely done!

Mcy3xh5oZnXSeMoXLc_PBQ.text: Luci's has become our go-to spot! This is a very special place in the city. The food and coffee are delicious, but the thing that keeps drawing me back again and again is the LOVELY SPACE. This has got to be one of the most spacious and well laid out places for friends, families and communities to come together. The gift shop is well-designed and beautifully curated. The staff is friendly and always helpful. Michelle creates such a great atmosphere! We really appreciate the drive-thru option for busy mornings. There's even a splash pad for the kiddos! We love you, Luci's at the Orchard!

DvHesYW9ILex8yh7vVH4Zg.text: This is such a great cafe! I would never have found this place unless I was invited by my friends. Food was delicious and price was sorta pricy but nothing exorbitant. I would definitely go back again and again and also tell more people about this place!

k3IvDhLIVZFM0aVveuquIg.text: Finally! Someone in Phoenix creates a patio with trees, greenery, shade and water! On the site of a former nursery, the folks who built Luci's and Pomelo at The Orchard did a great job with the interior and exterior decor and landscaping. There's plenty of parking, too. Luci's has a charming interior with fun and quirky gifts to buy. You order at the counter and the servers bring your food to your table. The mochas are delish. My only beef? The food's just not that good. If it was better, I would have given it the extra star. If you have a business meeting and don't want to be around squealing little ones, stay away from the patio. It has a splash pad and the kids go crazy for it. But if you're there to just hang out, it's entertaining to watch them.

lsSmzj_hLeev38M03xNYQw.text: Such a cute date spot!! Good for a day date, if the heat allows. Yummy food in big portions for a reasonable price. Hidden gem of Arcadia

NFMFRWbbU4PuRZeDDd8QwQ.text: This was my first time to Luci's and I immediately fell in love with her charm.  The outside seating, lush vegetation, cute splash pad and scattered table were adorable. Loved the darling store part where everything I saw was tempting to buy.   I found the staff to be knowledgeable and sort of friendly, but not overly so.  Not sure what it was exactly, but just the overall vibe didn't say "we are thrilled to be here and glad you have joined us".   We ordered a sandwich and salad to split and did appreciate that they split the sandwich for us and gave us each some potato salad.  We sat outside which looked nice, but we were almost immediately attached by black flies. There were so many that it became impossible to eat because we were just trying to shooo them away.  That was a bummer.  The club sandwich was beautifully presented and flavorful but a little hard to eat.  The chop salad had lots of ingredients and all were fresh and delish.  I got an Arnold Palmer ($4.00 or more) and was a bit disappointed when I was told they would refill the tea part but the lemonade was extra. Really?  After I just paid over $4.00 for a cup with lots of ice in it the first time. I felt like it was baseball stadium pricing.    I would come back for sure because the ambience was spectacular, the food was good and I am thinking the flies were just temporary.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love my mug from Luci&#39;s!  Great little store inside.
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute sign and delish custard
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love this splash park!

MPFAb5Y9AbeyBXeEnTakSA.text: Would be REAL helpful if you warned people you "turn the grill off" after 5 pm, hence no fresh food! Idiots!

eH1Z7qgAlPM9I5dQkh_sAg.text: I've gone to Luci's Marketplace which I like,  and was told about this place so me and my girlfriends decided to try it out. Its a, find your own table, type of restaurant. Its a good thing I got there before the rest of my party because I had to hunt down a table. Its so packed that people are helicoptering around tables that may free up. I even saw a squabble between two parties about who got to the table first. NOPE. I HATE having to hunt a table down. Heaven forbid you wait in the long line to order your food first and then end up not finding a table to sit at. Its just ridiculous. Then there's people who know others are waiting to sit, they've finished their meal and just sit around chatting the morning away when they really should move on and let someone have their table.  I think this system works during the week when it's not as busy, but on weekends, they really should have a host seating people.  The food- I didn't bother taking a picture of. I got the traditional breakfast which had scrambled eggs, turkey sausage, roasted potatoes and toast. Nothing to rave about. The others got the Orchard omelette and chilaquiles which neither of them found too special.  Overall, we wouldn't come back. Too much hustle and inconvenience to find our own seat for food that wasn't terrible - just not worth the trouble.

DRMGkLp-1MHz0XOdNANyQQ.text: Service is always great, staff is friendly, food is always good.  Been to Luci's over 15 times and never had a bad experience.

WQoBsKL6vKD29bbakRONeQ.text: Ok first of all they have their landline without service...I tried to call my friends to let them know  I was on my way and it was impossible...  This was my first visit to the Orchard, it's a very nice place in a residential neighborhood, you can easily miss it if you are speeding or distracted, they have parking lot in front and in the back, and it's surrounded by trees.  The ambience is relaxed, they have a splash pad for  the little ones, and some tables with shade. They do also sell ice cream and drinks, breakfast all day and sandwiches-salads and chicken nuggets for the kids, but you need to make a loooong line to check out, even it they do have 2 cashiers working at the same time.  I wish they had more shade,specially on the top of the splash pad, it's very nice to enjoy the sunshine however we are in March and the sun is already "burning" I cannot imagine June or July temperatures...the kids are running barefoot and the have artificial grass, it was soft for me but my son complained, the paths where kids are walking have some cemented areas and rocks!!!  The kind of rocks that are edgy and pointy...wish I could take a picture but my hands were full... I think they definitely need to consider to improve the place making it more safe but at the same time kid friendly. Also I wish they do recycle and had separate bins I was not able to find any.   Also when I was about to pick my drink I found they have Perrier, but the fridge was broken or just off, so it was not cold....another disappointment   Talking now about the food, I ordered a spicy crunchy chicken sandwich with salad and a strip chicken nuggets with fries for my kid, I ordered my sandwich to go, and once I got home and opened my box I was really disappointed... First no extra napkins, just the small thin napkins that comes with your plastic fork, also no seasonings, I found my friends who ate at the place had for them so I expected I had them included too, nope...zilch  Then when I gave the first bite to my sandwich I found the chicken was dry and burnt..I attached  a picture of my son chicken nuggets and the chicken of my sandwich so you can compare and tell I'm not crazy haha  I figured out the chipotle color added darkness, however no...it was over fried..I understand they have many costumers and orders to fulfill, maybe not enough staff at the kitchen, maybe the person who cooked my chicken was afraid of substitution for a new one and take longer or to be charged for the one they burned...I don't know however my experience was not the one I was expecting, I felt like if I ordered some chicken sandwich from KFC and still KFC would be better because it's not burnt! considering they do also have a restaurant next door from part of the same business, well I expected the same quality of food and service according to the place, anyway maybe next time I will visit early morning, I will keep my kid with sandals all times and I will stick with drinks instead of trying to experience tasting their food, and I will suggest you to do the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

L7hD9B_yTUJYRcXvaZUm3g.text: Cute lil space. My husband and I finished hiking Piestewa and headed here for brunch afterwards. Counter service was efficient enough, the pastries looked absolutely amazing (although we didn't try them.) we ordered a breakfast burrito, chilaquiles a Bloody Mary and a grapefruit sculpin. We found a table and our good and bevvies came out quickly. The drinks were just what we needed after that 98* hike. The burrito was ok- coulda used a lil more salsa on the side. The chilaquiles were just ok. Definitely needed more salt, more salsa- just more flavor in general. I would return and try something else. We really enjoyed the vibe- and enjoyed laughing about how disgusting we looked compared to everyone else in the place. Hahaha

ckHD9tMimlih0ShSyInkUQ.text: This place is so delightful! The atmosphere combined with the great food and area for kids to play warms my heart! We will definitely be back!

jnwS-yu3ziVL75W0cYfujQ.text: Cute little "cafe" in Phoenix. I'll admit the set up was a little confusing, especially if it was your first time.   Initially I couldn't tell where the cafe began and the little indoor marketplace ended. The food is was simple and delicious. The drinks were good as well.  The girls were super nice and made my friend and me feel very welcome.  The only complaint I have is the parking is slightly confusing, and the prices are a little too high. However, being in that part of Phoenix, it's a given.  Luci's was cute and a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating with the sandwich
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arnold Palmer

bBOV5UUa4q-pAsClY8GiSA.text: The setting is beautiful and the concept is amazing. Great amenities for any occasion and taste. I just have to say so far I'm disappointed in the coffee and breakfast. The drip Coffee was bland and weak, and I ordered a frittata that wasn't cooked long enough. Still runny in the middle and the veggies were all mushy with no flavor. This place is so close to perfect. With a little attention to details and customer service too, this place would be 5 Star.

1L_9kawQAX1Z-_ZGJASuSQ.text: This is by far one of my favorite places in Phoenix! They have it all! The marketplace serves salad, sandwiches, smoothies, beer, wine, juices and best of all breakfast is served all day! (We always go for the Funky Monkey French Toast). But it's doesn't stop there. Connected to the marketplace is Splurge (a homemade gelato shop that will satisfy your sweet-tooth) The gelato is all natural and the flavors always change, they even have an adult-only root beer float, and don't forget to indulge in some of the retro candy they sell.  Once you decide on some food and gelato make sure to take it outside and bask in the Arizona sun (under misters and of course shade) You can even bring your little ones to play in the splash pad!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gelato for kids of all ages...
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. What a beautiful environment The Orchard provides!

8hGGaV2H53GNg84RJulWgA.text: Definitely not in same league as la Grande Orange  Similar style but just not hitting that level .

-jFVZydl9NKiTaYDxZ-qUw.text: Had the worst experience ever, sat outside with a bunch of flys around me and my food, the servers are very rude and just directing me to pick up my coffee from one place then the milk is at the other end.. customer service skills are horrible, at least bring it to the table as I asked in the first place since I'm a first time customer.. anyway my family and I aren't coming back and it was an awful experience..

ucO92-oWJa9qS0rmbFomxw.text: Held my daughters bridal shower here. Everyone said it was beautiful. The food was awesome (French toast, breakfast burritos, fresh fruit, lemon scones, blueberry and banana nut muffins all to die for) and the adult beverages were very good. The two person hostess staff were very attentive, taking care of all guests requests and we had 34 guests so they had their hands full. Linda was very accommodating helping to coordinate decor and party rental companies. There were two cons: Linda called me on these two items practically after hitting send. She let me know they were on top of one of the items and I realized the other item was an oversight on my part. So impressed with how Luci's handled every facet of this event from booking, the actual event, and now even my review. I'm even more impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_UJ2adh9rGeHwwS4sjdtLQ.text: I really enjoy this place! I've been here a couple times and it's really nice. I've gotten an Iced Chai both times and it's great. The vibe is pleasant and calm. There's an outside seating area as well so you have plenty of space to enjoy whatever you decide on. They have a pretty full menu, including brunch. I recommend this place often, do give it a try.

E2Mf2gP6pRe4x9w9LnYtrA.text: This place is adorable. I came on a Sunday afternoon with a friend and had a fresh juice and the chilaquiles. I was very impressed with the space.  There is basically 3 or 4 restaurants in one space! I was less impressed with my food though. I'd like to try the other eateries in the orchard.

fAEwccReKb3_2PTxlmx5XQ.text: This place has a great ambiance. It's set up where you order your food at a register and it's self seating. The flowers, trees and lighting make it intimate and perfect for casual meals. Monday's and Tuesday's they offer pizza and a bottle of wine for $20. I will definitely have to come back.   I ordered the Spaniard Omelette and my partner got the biscuits and gravy. Got our food within 10 mins of ordering. The omelet was flavorful and not spicy considering it has chicken chorizo. His biscuits and gravy were hot and the gravy was so so..   Definitely a go to place for brunch soon with my ladies and pizza and wine :)

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TYT1Ydr1i0hUpeGNdgzVWg.text: So, my birthday breakfast with David was at Luci's, a place I've been wanting to try out for some month now. Walking into the grounds was phenomenal, and entering the restaurant portion was awesome. David ordered the traditional breakfast, over easy, and I ordered the corned beef benedict. After getting cups of water, we waited on the beautiful park-like grounds and waited for our food to arrive. And waited, because we were both quite hungry. So by the time our breakfasts arrived, we both dug in. To lukewarm dishes. While the flavors were there, the missing heat made it hard to truly appreciate our meals. We finished our food and let it digest a few minutes before leaving. Sadly.  While it may have been a fluke that our food wasn't brought out hot, it has hampered our desire to return anytime soon. Don 't get me wrong, I do plan on returning. Just not certain how quickly that will happen.

bWfK_00wq_mZlyZPsxBGaw.text: Fantastic place. It is a Gem in that part of town. The food was great. Great outdoor eating area. Luci's has very well trained, helpful & friendly servers and staff. It is a fun place,  great for kids & families. Luci's is a Home Run.  Thanks.

-oFt1VA7q4pgV1FLnVUAZw.text: Wow!! Loved the spicy crispy chicken sandwich (with fries) for lunch. Tons of options on the menu and breakfast served all day. Finish your meal off with a sweet craving at splurge ice cream. Want to see more review and pics? Check out TableforKate on instagram! Thanks!

vzPvAU8AIp8Y1DuMGTq1uA.text: Good vibes out here at the Orchard. The Spanish Omelet was a little to plain and healthy for my American pallet, which for $11 was a bit of a disappointment. Service was good so that is always a nice plus in addition to having quality water. 3 solid stars

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t9A4zGOSpCESvAgm4wG2ww.text: I absolutely LOVE Luci's at the Orchard!! Talk about the cutest spot in town for a friend gathering, mom gathering, splash pad date with kiddos, work-from-home escape, event, etc. Luci's is literally all of the things! It is perfectly located in Midtown Phoenix and has the most welcoming vibes.   They have a large grassy area in the center of Pomelo and Luci's that is perfect for parties. Two of my friends have hosted parties here in the past 6 months and both were absolutely outstanding. I'm at the age group where many of my friends have small children (ages newborn - 2 years) and this venue is perfect for everyone. The kiddos can run around, parents can mingle, and trust me, this is a space that you'll want to hang out at all day long!   I absolutely LOVE their breakfast burritos and iced green tea. Their ice cream is also pretty fab. The kiddos LOVE it. Their sandwiches are yummy as well. You really can't go wrong at Luci's. When my little babe is born, you better believe we'll be coming here on the regular! See you soon, Luci's!

u-0v7GorHKDbIOlx3lXc4A.text: I have to give this place 5 Stars. It is a beautiful conglomeration of eateries tuck away on 12th Street just south of Glendale Road. There is: Luci's, a breakfast-all-day and sandwich shop wrapped commingled with a gift shop with both indoor and outdoor dining. They serve craft beers there. There is an ice cream/candy store (I'm taking the grand babies), a gorgeous patio with a slash pad and a large canopied area. There is also a Mexican Restaurant! My girlfriend drives past it all the time on the way to her brother's house but has never stopped in. There is a prominent faux pax water tower over a nice seating area. It was jumping! Ok let's get to the food; it was excellent, very fresh that includes vegan and gluten free choices (I'm trying to pay more attention to those things for you folks with dietary restrictions- you're covered here!) I ordered the daily special which was a grilled cheese sandwich that turned out to be grilled ham and tomatoes- hahahaha, a mistake? I don't know, don't care, it was perfect! It came with a choice of sides; fries, potato salad, fruit or veggies, I ordered the fries, they were good. My girlfriend wanted an egg sandwich on a croissant. She chose chopped veggies to go in the scrambled eggs (she saw a plate of croissants and-) It was a beautiful day and we sat outside. I noticed swirling shiny anti-pigeon devices that seemed to be working. We shared a table with strangers which always works for me. This is a little gem of a place and I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

y4aEDKE9eAwncq0zycGnuA.text: Have always gone to the original Luci's on Bethany... but had my pup today and was meeting my friend so decided to meet at this one at the Orchard.  Got there and stood inline behind a few families ordering big breakfast orders.  I ordered a coffee. That's it. "What's your name?"  I tell them. " you can pick that up over there".  Okay. I wait. I wait. I wait.  Decide to go to the restroom . I come back and say..." surely you called my name?".  "Uh.. no.... I'm just working on it". Really? It's a cup of coffee. Even gross Starbucks gives you a coffee immediately. ( wasn't a specialty coffee... just plain).  Finally get it and go outside. Didn't realize it was Day Care that day. Not a place on property without screaming kids. Really?  I was able to score 2 chairs under the white umbrella.  Don't you think there are still customers that still would like a place that is quiet and not in the play ground? Maybe this section should be roped off from kids? Just a thought.  Coffee was so terrible. Decided to do mimosas.  Needed the alcohol to deal with the screeching!  Oh.... for $6 each.... maybe you can fill the glass?  Honestly.... don't go here if you want a quiet morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HfmBmJZoNU5dc2JbVysK9A.text: Love this place and the set up.  So peaceful and quiet. Super kid friendly, and a beautiful atmosphere. I love coming here with my little one to relax and enjoy the weather.  Although I do not like all the fly's, but it's typical for an outside patio.   If you order any salad make sure to ask if they can add a little more dressing because each time I've ordered salads, the dressing is a little light.   They also have an ice cream shop that I have not been to, but I'm sure it's delish. I would love to have an event here or my baby shower.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Little man enjoying the weather sipping on his juice
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. He ate the whole cheeseburger

Qfze3i0cRGveoW8QjpIytw.text: Giving 3 stars hoping to get someone's attention! The venue and food are excellent but the seating is extremely uncomfortable!! We quickly finished our breakfast to get out of there which may be the goal of management! I cannot be the first person to notice this problem! Let's take up a collection to help this poor restaurant get better chairs!

fgcUxNwaMPDAJmnyXpydxQ.text: They have a great Dirty Chai and nice outside area for Sunday with the family! The food looks great although I didn't try anything during this visit. If you're a caffeine connoisseur such as myself you'll enjoy a nice drink out on the patio!

RQZoiw0S4rzs_x02UHsrDA.text: Update: do you know of any other company who reaches out after a 4 Star review??? Because I certainly don't! Someone at Luci's messaged me and apologized for the toy troubles. I really did like the place already and would have recommended it to anyone in earshot but this emphasis on customer service makes them a 5-Star place if you ask me! I think other companies could take note from this.   I'm only docking this place a star because of the little gift shop with kid height toys on your way through the line. I was pretty much duped into getting my kid something and then the toys didn't even work. In fact all of the battery operated items seemed to be lacking batteries. Oh well. I returned it without issue and my 3 year old had a mild meltdown but that's just life with a 3 year old some days.   The food was great. I got the French toast to share with the kiddo and husband got the Grinder sandwich. Both were awesome and we'll go back just so my husband get another sandwich. We sat inside and afterward the kids in our group played on the splash pad.  It was hot, but that isn't the restaurant's fault.   It was fun. I'll go back. Just check your toys occasionally to make sure they work please. If not replace the batteries. You can't taunt a toddler with toys. It turns bad fast.

TRdHAhCYLZdkxyFP-cpGqg.text: Got take out breakfast this one time and loved it! I ordered the corned beef benedict and it was a winner. Generous portions of tasty meat with poached eggs cooked right. I added some avocado too. The english muffins were lightly toasted and the hollandaise sauce had good flavors.  Will order from here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2k09DHc0A3KC0nRT0FKj_A.text: I can't say enough good things about my experience with Luci's. I was looking for a venue for my sisters bridal shower and wasn't finding anything I loved for a reasonable price. I came across Lucis and from my first interaction with Linda I knew I had found the perfect place. She was so helpful and accommodating. We were able to use the outdoor tented area for our event and it was absolutely beautiful. The menu and food options I had to choose from were excellent and they taste and presentation of them was the same. We had a 3 hour event their with our own bartender who also made sure everything was perfect before, during and after. I can't wait to have another reason to have an event here!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8SBpeIaa7y6gsdpfqZpRLw.text: With good food, coffee, and a limited, yet intentional selection of cocktails, beer, and wine Luci's is a nice place to waste away an afternoon in Uptown. With its decor, menu offerings, and a variety of tchotchkes, Luci's perfectly complements the laidback feeling that the Orchard creates.

hsHU3hfqpl3xxdE-gCU9-w.text: Favorite place ever! I wish I could come every single day. Always so yummy and fresh!!! Plus the atmosphere is so unique and homey. Thanks for always being amazing. The Funky Monkey French Toast is always a must!!!!!!!! Especially as soon as it comes out. So warm and soft!

zPbj0os3PAW1Ts_AUb3bGQ.text: Luci's at the Orchard is a True gem! The cutest property with two restaurants, lots of outdoor seating, and even a little splash pad for the kids. But.... It was 106 degrees today, so we sat inside. Luci's is a walk up and order place, then they deliver to your table. To a person everyone who worked there was awesome.  As an example, my son ordered ice cream (bubble gum!), but didn't like it. They not only exchanged it for another flavor (mint chip!), but refunded our money.  We ordered a club sandwich, my favorite, a Reuben, and a kid's cheeseburger. The fries that came with the sandwiches were great and my son's burger was good too. The sandwiches were good quality, nothing too exciting. We want to go back and try their breakfast offerings. Especially once the temps go down and we can sit outside! Oh, and also to try Pomelo, the other restaurant on site.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside at Luci&#39;s
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute seating area
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside Luci&#39;s

Two5hqIeP7jbPV1kfL0aFQ.text: I'm a big fan of the original Luci's Healthy Marketplace at 16th Street and Bethany. So I was hoping the appeal of that location would transfer here.   Pros: Beautiful property with lots of outdoor seating. Perfect if you have dogs (or kids). The food and drinks are delicious. And if you can maneuver around the crowds the gift shop has lots of cute options.   Cons: Long wait to order, long wait to get drinks, may have to drive around to find parking (the parking lot is shared with Pomelo), and it's crowded.   I met a few friends on a brisk winter day so I thought it wouldn't be as busy as say a Saturday in March. Based on this visit I can imagine you'd be waiting a very long time when the weather is nice.   I waited in line for 20+ min to put in an order and then another 10 min to get my coffee (an Americano so nothing fancy). Luckily the actual food order was quite fast after this. Once we found a table outside and could eat and drink I really enjoyed Luci's. I don't live in the neighborhood though so perhaps next time I visit I'll opt for drive thru.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute gift shop to browse while the rest of your party waits in massive line for Sunday brunch.

spVliAbKU6_wqR7192SNZA.text: This place is beautiful. A not so hidden gem as it was packed. There were a few baby showers going on so I understood why the service was slow. The Cobb salad was big, fresh and delicious.   I will be back once the weather stops punishing us so I can sit outside and enjoy the garden. I was turned off by the free roaming screaming kids but that's no fault of the establishment.

MUQjGZGzvcw4WuCwBVa7Lw.text: Wish we could have had a bite here - it is super cute but had the following issues: - NOT bike friendly. Took us a while to find the racks and they were jammed inside a semi-circle of where people were sitting in chairs - no way to get them in there without disrupting the other people's day and having our bikes on top of them and the rack design is horrible!!!  - Great for kids!!!!! But mine are grown and I'd rather not eat with someone else's running and screaming around me while I'm enjoying a nice brunch (what happened to manners parents? Restaurants are NOT playgrounds!!!!) Thinking I'll try again later than 7 (hopefully the kids are in bed then) and via car.

fov3rPwgzJJWePKq4svu-A.text: From last review the management team had reached out to me and wanted to make things better from the last food experience I had. The management team was absolutely amazing! I seriously cannot think of another place that really wanted to make my experience better. I gave them a second try and had breakfast, I had the french toast and it was amazing! It tasted so good, definitely worth the drive. I do plan to come back to Lucia's and have more amazing breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ds-BI5iujCoVQSYP9EEZaA.text: We had an eclair and some other pastries here. The ambiance of the cafe and store is super cute. I bought a 3D greeting card for my grandma here. I also bought quite a few Homeboys jalapeno hot sauces from the youtube show Hot Ones where they do interviews while eating increasingly spicy hot wings.  I could have sworn that the price displayed was less than what I paid for but I was distracted at the checkout talking with my friend. I would recommend getting the chipotle hot sauce instead of the  jalapeno. I think it's more flavorful, plus it's the one they use to use on the show. They carry all sorts of knick knacks which would make good gifts. I think there were some locally produced products available. I would love it if they made locally made products a little more obvious. The jewelry was cute, but not my style.   We dined at the next door Pomelo (pizza and such) before heading over here. Combined, it's an adorable Phoenix venue. I could see someone holding a wedding or big party here.   The cashier and pastry case employees could have been more friendly. It was near closing time, but we didn't linger.

odv3HxqGpB1m-YApfcEa3Q.text: Went for breakfast. Had a good variety food was good prices reasonable. Sat outside which was pleasant. Staff was attentive. Inside you may shop for various items think Cracker Barrel on smaller scale.  Over all a pleasant experience better than ihop but have had other places that were more "exciting "

5KSVoIY_iLqtfuJwiIFRVQ.text: This was our first time visiting here. It was a unique establishment with nice outdoor seating.   An eclectic restaurant, with a full menu. Everything we ordered was delicious. My wife enjoyed the gifts they sold too. Very trendy. Very cool!

rg5wizFnK9Fq_duge63VAw.text: Atmosphere is 5 star but my breakfast frittata was not hot when it arrived. I noticed another reviewer had the same complaint. The meal looked great, filled with mushrooms, red peppers, spinach, potato chunks and more, but temperature was not right on arrival. Noticed no heat lamps in the area where meals are left for pickup or in kitchen prep area. Food needs to be hot on arrival.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frittata

PNY74ke8HahcZOJ7l77VHA.text: My friends and I found this place due to it being the same spelling as my friend's name. So we came not knowing what to expect. The whole place is absolutely beautiful! It's coffee house meets family meets restaurant. I got the Reuben stack with a side of fries. The cashier said to get the fries because they have "pretty good fries." I shrugged because everyoneeeee thinks they have good fries. I got them anyways and she was NOT kidding. Such good fries!! Their banana nut muffin is amazing as well. Overall- food was amazing. The cashier was so helpful, kind, and bright. I live in the east valley... and this is a no brained that I will gladly make a 45+ minute drive to eat here again.

Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Reuben stack and club sandwich. Chocolate muffin and banana nut muffin.

S3B9xifeV2tt99GxWl3EWw.text: Beautiful place! You can come and hang out on the grass or a bench and just enjoy the comforts of a cool and fun place. Lots of great foo dads to buy. There was no problem parking. The servers are so sweet! I'm gonna go back in and get some gifts when I am done with my salad!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0bHPICjzetrRbD0ln8nwYw.text: This is just an absolute wonderful place to hang out.  Met some friends there yesterday for brunch and I can't wait to go back. The grounds were beautiful! Surrounded by trees and lots of shrubs almost makes you feel like you're not in the desert. The food was delicious and they also have an ice-cream shop. Staff was super friendly. They have separate restaurants. One has more of a cafe feel as the other is a little more upscale-maybe for dinner. This is on the top of my list of favorite places to hang out, relax and enjoy.

6SwUzwJLQpy3BOE2ZJ_0Jg.text: What a great place.  Awesome healthy selection and fair r prices with a great ambiance.  I knew Luci way back in the day and she always had a great flare to make things happen.  This is perfect for any appetite all day long with fine dining in the evening.  We ordered a cross selection of foods and deserts,  all were exceptional.

5w704mMQUn3UQohcYa48uA.text: We visited both Luci's at the Orchard and the original Luci's healther market while we were in Phoenix.  Both are absolutely wonderful A-plus eateries!

NuPgALtwsbdbA5KwMzpE0Q.text: Cutest place!!! We were staying at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort and were looking for somewhere to eat for breakfast. Luci's is very close so we decided to give it a try. We were very happy! Amazing food! Great service! Great atmosphere! Loved it! Will definitely return when in the area.

hzoMC2iL6l-GAZ4z9hlSQg.text: Luci's at the orchard is a great place to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee, treat or meal.  I especially love coming here because of the beautiful grounds, the vibe and love their iced tea and food.   I love the chilaquiles for breakfast!  All that and the fact that it's so kid friendly, there's really not a lot of places like this!  With 3 boys, we always have to pick a place where it's kid friendly otherwise it's torture for us! LOL   They have an ice cream shop, although prices are pretty steep ($4/scoop of ice cream) but I guess we'll suck it up since we can kill a couple hours eating on the patio while kids play in the splash pad and grassy area.  We usually finish our visit with an ice cream cone!   Thanks Luci's for creating such a fantastic place with delicious food.

kQ2vYjnTYvm6IMo629Ab7w.text: Nice place! Found this place after a recommendation from another cafe. Has a rustic and modern feel. Food is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretty cool set up!

wNZJh8QRAXzqIT2kEGblZA.text: I gotta be honest, there's nothing food-wise on their menu that I crave. No dish that I can't wait to go back for, but their food is fresh and clean. The ambiance and environment is tip top, and here's the best part, their 'chai' is a syrup. Add that to your Americano, no cream, VERY good, best in town.

EFqV_jW_YCLapgzEf-QjAg.text: Horrible experience over the holidays at Luci's at the Orchard and also the location at 16 th St and Bethany. I purchased $100 in gift cards and received a $20 bonus gift card. YAY!!  Not so fast,  to make a very long story short, the gift cards had $0 on them. I gave one for a gift, how embarrassing!  The whole situation trying to resolve the error took over 6 weeks and 5 trips to Luci's  and remains not fully resolved. I received $70 in gift cards!  They stole from me. No compensation for the inconvenience and no apologies for their errors. It sickens me to even think I would go back there.  So much for supporting a small business in my neighborhood.  I

lWIQZfw0Cs1WGKRmjtNupA.text: I absolutely love Luci's at the Orchard, great atmosphere and great food! I have been for breakfast and lunch and highly recommend both! The service is great and very attentive and they have plenty of outdoor seating to enjoy the beautiful weather and have misters on hotter days as well! They also have a small splash pad as well to keep the kiddos happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0MfejyPTN3ojCgwNgIpMLA.text: A great place for families... Delicious food and room for the kids to play. More of a cafe type atmosphere (which we love).  We live in the neighborhood and find that this is a charming place to take out-of-town family for a relaxed meal.

eh0iDIfhqnHvV29-hy3FnA.text: I absolutely ADORE this place. It's close to home and tucked away in a residential area so it feels cozy and friendly. The landscaping is beautiful and creates a green, shady ambiance. There's a splash pad for the kids and quirky, adorable gifts and trinkets to explore inside the store. The food is great and the whole place has a very relaxed vibe, a good place to meet up with someone to sip coffee and chat. The parking lot in the back is deceptively large, there is actually a fair amount of places to park. They also do a fantastic job with special events! My brother and his wife had their rehearsal dinner there and the outside area was transformed with lighting and seating to create a very special atmosphere for the celebration. A lot of other reviews seem to be docking points for the lines. To be frank, this is not a super huge restaurant and it has become very popular. It's not that they are being slow with food and drinks, it's just that there are a lot of people ahead of you. Worth the wait if you ask me.

qwPsgL65YNSfcwWB-xw4_g.text: I've eaten at Luci's other location many times, this was my first time trying the Orchard location. My boyfriend and I came for sunday brunch. I got a smoothie and the orchard omelet and he got the corned beef benedict. The food was great. The atmosphere is great too, a little more quaint than the other location. Just be warned it's super busy on weekends so it could take a little while to get your food!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smoothie!
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Orchard Omelet

atKafcKD9MmQA5ve9vn5Jw.text: This was my first time here, at the recommendation of my sister. Wow!  I met my son here as he was breezing thru town. This place has lots of personality!  They have cute indoor seating along with a unique boutique. Then, they have a beautiful outdoor seating area. I'm an Arizon native, but don't like the summer heat much - so we sat inside. The food was also awesome. I had the pancakes - they were perfect.

Ouk0FyH47rdmNMjeiFMikA.text: This place is great! Great service, great food, and great times! They also have a little splash pad that the kids just love. I can just sit at a table and watch them while sipping my coffee!

6qEkC1ij5b3VD5UyfBQQPg.text: The setting for this place couldn't get better. It is like an oasis in the desert. The food is always good here. Inside is a little cramped, especially if they are busy. I had a very hard time finding salt and pepper or getting the attention of an employee to find any either. Took about 20 minutes and finally the couple next to me offered theirs. I would recommend this location to anyone looking for a tasty breakfast, brunch or lunch!! The staff is also very friendly every time I go in.

x0oDplH_wNfWPnRQKc80cg.text: Came to Luci's for breakfast and like all the other reviews this is a nice location. Open, lots of parking, and a great outdoor space.   Service was excellent and extremely friendly.   My only issue was the food or at least what I ordered left a lot to be desired.  I ordered the Orchard Omelet. When it arrived it looked and smelled delicious.  My only issue is that once I cut into the omelet all the moisture/water from the veggies was still inside so it was soupy. It would have been helpful if prior to cooking the kitchen drained/dried the veggies properly. There was so much residual water it sucked out all the flavor of the omelet. I literally had to drain it off my plate.   I would come back but I won't be ordering that omelet again.

zWS1piobiojkrOQ0EGhnsQ.text: It's a Cracker Barrel for hipsters (my daughter actually came up with that, but it's such a great line that I have to repeat it!). Tasty food, inviting garden seating, nifty stuff in the gift shop area - what's not to like? Rather on the spendy side, but perfect for all the young, with-it urban parents, and their adorable toddlers (see: splash pool).

f65-93eTMCXWue3YGHIvsw.text: This is probably my favorite place to study! Love the atmosphere and the staff. The staff knows me by name and they always make me feel very welcomed every time I come in.

3RtBtQVOEoYtRY1j7REr2A.text: Such a cute location with great outdoor space to sit and let the little ones play. Food is tasty it not memorable to the degree that makes you want to rush back - but there are few places in that bracket (Snooze, maybe).  Great little shop to look around inside whilst you decide on what to order, too.

Zj2BvXnsZl85FVIIdniMAg.text: Nice breakfast spot. Order at the counter (no worries the line moves fast) pick up your coffee and head out to the deck and garden to await you breakfast. Great food and coffee. The perfect spot to relax on a lazy Saturday. Nice little gift shop area with unique items as well

dGAgy33SgbwkSCufax03sA.text: Great place for breakfast or brunch. Really kid friendly indoor and outdoor seating. Food is great, I had the Burrito Bomb and Toxin Boxin juice. Great, good sized portions and tasty!

3eMsgfdJicuajZa8AjPJ1A.text: Enjoyed a great Iced Latte and I highly recommend the Orchard Omelette!  Staff is friendly, great service!

fYbo-6MJ06PdyyASEgujXg.text: The employees are super friendly, the food is very good and there's enough seating both inside and outside. It has a very nice vibe and is just warm and super fun place to have breakfast or lunch!!

NWhEZOYHNiwCJePpE3Hjlg.text: Cute, quaint & delicious. Great place for families with small children to eat outside (under shade) & let those lil ones giggle their wiggles out! Bring a change of clothes for them - the water feature is the bonus!

U47j8nhK1KjgZPSNpnp7UQ.text: Fabulous ambiance and even better food. Yummy little spot tucked away in a tree-shaded courtyard.

M-QQPEF6aIa3vTXUD43O2A.text: What a beautiful place, I was so excited to visit a small business. Walked into a small shopping experience and went through the line to order and shop more while you wait for your food.  Food ordered, we were given our number and sat down at a bar looking out onto the patio. Even on Christmas Eve morning, people were enjoying the patio with the heaters turned on.  We ordered a regular breakfast plate and I was excited by the Funky Monkey French toast Gluten-free. Our food arrived and I looked at a plate of regular looking French toast. Still not having gotten my drink, food was dropped and we didn't see anyone again... I went up front and asked about my drink and was told that it was sitting at the other counter. Nice, you give me a number indicating that it would be delivered to our table. She was completely unapologetic and said, no it gets made and sits there there... So I asked about the Gluten-free funky monkey. Turns out if you order Gluten-free you get regular Gluten-free bread... Not the Funky monkey cinnamon French toast as the menu reads. All in all, disappointed. Service was not good. I won't be back.   Posted are photos showing the menu GF Funky Monkey and actual served French toast

czqclh0QdpjEyYW9BQQFLw.text: So...I really should have followed up on this sooner.  Humble apologies!  My experience post tuna salad was nothing short of fantastic.  Ken, GM/Owner, made immediate contact with me and apologized that the nuts were not listed, and invited me back in.  We ended up chatting and having a great conversation.  I was made whole for the situation and had some lunch Luci's sister restaurant, Pomelo. Alicia took very good care of me and all of the staff was fantastic.  I will resume my lunch orders with Luci's with confidence, and hope everyone gives them a shot. Thank you again, Ken, for your help. Its no wonder that you have such a great staff.

AW1yuU1MtH1-Jd-1uQhDOg.text: This is our new favorite spot for mimosas & breakfast with live music on Sunday morning! When we first got there the line was out the door but it moved pretty quick and we were amazed that we didn't have to wait a long time for our food, despite how busy it was!   The $5 mimosas kept us happy while we waited and we loved that there is a separate drink ordering counter so we could get our mimosa refills without having to jump back in the long food ordering line!   We both had the Spaniard omelette that has chicken and chorizo and it was delicious!   While the inside of the place is super neat with all kinds of cute merchandise, the outdoor patio and open grass area is really where it's at. Beautiful trees and greenery all around make you forget you're in the desert for a second! The last two Sunday's we've enjoyed live acoustic music from a girl and her guitar (beautiful voice). She started playing and singing around 9ish I believe.   Before we visited Luci's at the orchard we went to the Luci's marketplace which was neat--- but now that we've experienced the orchard, there's no turning back! We love it!

wqP9-Fo-q6YFcTFgKvnJxA.text: The fries were cold, the meat in the Ruben was dry. My friends burger was also cold.   The staff disappeared after placing the food in the table. When the manager stopped by just before we left, his only comment was that he would check why this was happening in the kitchen.  After the many great meals, coffees, etc-ce-tera enjoyed at the original Luci's this place falls short. I hope they eventually get it right.

KmlvqBl_jQTegfTvitJ5bw.text: Order at the counter and still they screw up the order (you have one job!) But fun watching the servers trying to match the orders with tables as they wander about aimlessly.

uSbjibOtAoGyQNZZFepclg.text: As someone who tuned out the original Luci's years ago (the review is around -- that place just has me shaking my head), I was hesitant to visit the Orchard in the first place. Well, I don't know who took control of this one but Luci's at the Orchard is excellent and the dining experience is a complete 180 from the original Luci's.   The menu has a list of options from classic egg dishes to your more granola options, plus the standard selection of baked goodies and blended drinks. The little shop area in the store is worth browsing but the kicker about Luci's at the Orchard is the space. The seating is plentiful with both inside and outside options. Tucked away north of Glendale there, the Orchard is a great little weekend brunch option.

1t-0-229WkPgpAEBDRv65g.text: Lovvvvve this place. Great food, coffee and fun treats/trinkets. Best of all is the atmosphere! Perfect place to sit outside on a nice day.

lfOv1CuGfZgLX3rJrp8grA.text: Hands down one of my favorite breakfast spots. Service is good. Food is awesome. Indoor and Outdoor seating. Great place to spend time with friends or a business meeting. Highly recommend.

rl1oyaFlN1unh0L0nDc4aA.text: Amazing Coffee! Well trained and knowledgeable Batista's. Great breakfast menu wide selection of grab and go food. Cute gift shop

Didn't taste anything spectacular or funky (in a good way ) but it was good and may very well taste even better at the restaurant than after a 15 min ride. vkIA-ZbdPkq7jdoW_MYQiw.text: Took a friend who had always wanted to go.  Very disorganized upon walking in.  Took a few minutes to figure out you had to order food in the same line people were ordering coffee.  Online menu is convenient but not up to date on prices.  I ordered the Traditional Breakfast which included toast.  I was asked if I would like a homemade English muffin instead of toast and I said sure.  After the fact, I was very surprised that I was charged an additional fee for the muffin.   I should have been told when ordering.  After we finished eating, I thought about asking for a refund but the line was so long and we didn't have time to wait.  Food was prepared well but with too much salt, not a heart smart endorsed eatery.  Meals are also large enough for two people to share or for one person to save half for later.  Would prefer smaller meals and lower prices.  I probably will not go back for 3 reasons.  Charged for something that said was included in the meal, meals too large consequently making the prices too large and the noise inside and out makes it difficult to carry on a pleasant conversation.  Overall not a comfortable place to eat.

K2krtM6n05aoTCHeT_Pwkw.text: I love this place. Where can you get fantastic gelato after a wonderful meal at Palmelo restaurant or sit in the country store for a cup of coffee or glass of wine. This is really my favorite place. Have to drive from Goodyear but it is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Carivore Pizza

XFmGySiRlA5mSmMZxA3o2A.text: I love this place! They have amazing salads, sandwiches, and breakfast options. The patio area is very cute and is great for brunch! Highly recommend visiting ALL their locations.

picdWuzwPCfjwN8hn4FgJg.text: How fun is this place? Have been to Luci's on Bethany many many times but never knew this place was here. I love Luci :) food is deliciousness, there are plenty of choices. Love the outdoor area, it's beautiful. Plenty of healthy choices in addition to Splurge! Only removed a star on the staff, they weren't really friendly or helpful. I inquired about hosting a bridal shower at the orchard and was told a web address to go to, no one offered a card or to write it down for me. Guess what? I forgot it, as expected. They also weren't all that friendly on two occasions now.

8WuMn7MKTyL4u9dzxCakaA.text: Love this place!  This is our go to, to get good food & if you are feeling down the staff will cheer you up with their smiles & encouraging words.  One of our favorite dishes is avocado toast. The salad bowls are fabulous & lots of choices. We love watching the kids play in the splash pad - I have been tempted to join them especially when the temp is over 100. A nice evening out can be enjoyed at Pomello. One of Jim's favourites is the Pork Chop - I have several - salmon, steak, steak salad. Just stop by and have a great evening.  They also can help you put on a fabulous party. The best all around venue in North Central. You need to try it - you will like it!

lVCRWMxeTlWgTGp_HEkKSA.text: Omgosh, I looooove this place!!!! This is the perfect place to come to with family or friends. This is also a dog-friendly place and there is a grass and water area for your little ones to enjoy themselves. Everything I've tried here is deeeeelish!!! I will come here, as long as it remains open!

JHIDTV3ETWDssQ5kHfHxCA.text: Very busy location, lots of foot traffic! Great place to hangout or study, I highly recommend their gelato!

PfVTjPOyRA_bYwLyx88AwQ.text: Absolutely love this place! There are two Luci locations, but The Orchard location is by far my favorite. They have a beautiful courtyard to enjoy a meal with friends during spring & fall and a very welcoming fire place inside for the winter!   I love there little gift section and the staff are always very helpful! One of my favorite places to take family and friends!  Ps. Their French Toast is UH-mazing!!!!!!

At7BAuH0uy8HrmYi370P0Q.text: We love Luci's! Especially this location! It is so kid friendly and a great place to get a bite to eat and hang out side. There is indoor seating as well but we usually go out and enjoy the splash pad. Such a cute spot. We love it!

Nph4aVZmJgXkrZhd1_ABGA.text: I was really excited to visit Luci's before leaving my trip to Phoenix. I stopped in with my family on my way to the airport at 7:30pm, I knew they were closing at 8pm - surely I could have ordered an espresso 30 minutes before closing right? Wrong. The girls refused to make me an espresso because they had already closed the espresso machine. How ridiculous is that? I understand wanting to get out of work early, but to refuse someone a service they want to pay for us absurd. The girls were also wrapping up the croissants with plastic as I was trying to order one, which made the croissants unappetizing. These girls also didn't know how to make a mocha. They made the experience very uncomfortable and unwelcoming. Maybe hire some smarter baristas that don't mind a little extra work next time.

eIN65qVj2hNH5fEKlk13WA.text: Atmosphere was very pretty and the pancakes were bomb.com! Will definitely come back and definitely recommend! Luci's was kid friendly and dog friendly too.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flapjacks and Lolea sangria

SfYIajJN2-Eb0_PQsLsBBA.text: Luci's is cute and fine. A few issues, though....They haven't given me decaf the last 2x I've been there. I've been pretty wired from the coffee Bevs I ordered. The service isn't great. Staff is very young and seems totally bored to be there. No one seems to be in charge so it's a bit chaotic. Last time I was there, no one called my name when my order was up and it had just been sitting there for awhile until, frustrated it was taking so long, I went to go ask about it. It also can be a bit uncomfortably warm in Luci's and it is Mommy and Me central. If you have a dark sense of humor, it is amusing to eavesdrop on all the groups of young mothers subtly shaming each other's parenting skills. The kids do shriek, so it might not be a good place for getting work done. But the space is great. The food is good. There's an ice cream parlor with old timey candy, a more upscale restaurant, lots of pastries and smoothies and lattes and super good bowls. They even have a retail area with cute tchotchkes. You'll love it if you need a place to take your kids. It has a small splash pad and a pretty big green space for them to run around. It's an overall nice place and the food is good.

STTv_UijNwQ1YoPnLsgfuw.text: Fantastic little place to sit and chit chat!! Great food!! Great coffee! A little something for everyone! Bring  the kids for fun in the sun and sprinklers!! Will be back!

5JXyC8V4KXPpfypYRN_4wA.text: I visited Luci's for the first time this past Monday. I had heard amazing things about Luci's. We had a burrito which was delicious, coffee which was great, and shared two pastries. A cinnamon roll and a scone. The baked goods were very disappointing. They did not taste fresh and the flavors weren't anything special. I would return for menu items, but would avoid pastries in the future.  Not sure if they were made in house or sourced out. If the later is True, then they need to look for another source.

N2LF66ScPmUvIpPe5BAzoQ.text: I've come here multiple times in the past and had an okay experience. Nothing exceptional but nothing bad, either.  Unfortunately, my experience this morning was only worth 1 star. I ordered pancakes with blueberries ($1 add on) and asked them to hold the powdered sugar on top. I saw the cashier ring in the addition and the special ask, however, my meal arrived with powdered sugar on top. No worries, I'm sure the kitchen is on auto pilot and VERY busy, especially on a Sunday around 11am.   The biggest disappointment was that the blueberry pancakes were NORMAL pancakes with literally 10 blueberries on top. I've never eaten blueberry pancakes with them on the outside, instead of the inside... especially at the price point they charge guests.   I wanted to call attention to this when a server/buster walked by, but I was not able to speak with them or flag them down. I considered going back up to the register but the line was out the door and it wasn't worth waiting.  I also asked for a cinnamon roll to go, because it looked SO good. Except when my roommate got to the middle, it was actually dough-y and undercooked, despite the outside of the pastry being very dry.   Overall, the best part of my meal was my orange juice. I'm sad to say that I likely won't return unless it's for some cold brew and a bagel on the way to work.

9rTYImikBxnVWcn8zESbcw.text: Such a fun place!!! The only thing that would make this place better is if they opened more locations in the valley!!! Food was delicious, coffee was tasty, and we loved making use of the splash pad!! I love the vibe inside and outside.

2z5sHWG2gwWTr-Xx4hmTbw.text: Had their featured drink; the pink drink (strawberry, lemonade and something else) and it was great! The entire complex is super cute, it consists of the brunch/coffee shop cafe area, the ice cream shop, (what I think is a) full service restaurant, a huge courtyard, fountains for kids to play in and an area to rent out for parties. The brunch/coffee shop cafe area is perfect for getting a good brunch, for getting work done or just relaxing/hanging out. I would definitely come back here as I love the atmosphere and all the random knick-knacks that are sold!  Please check out my collection: "The Valley's Best Coffee Shops + Houses," on my profile; featuring Luci's at the Orchard and other amazing Coffee Shops in Phoenix!

oCClAgJP7oFcCQLWNClePw.text: I just wanted to update my review and say I was very pleased by the costumer service here at Luci's. Truthfully, the way a business treats and responds to their costumers can make or break them and I'm happy to report that Luci's goes the extra mile in ensuring that everyone has a wonderful experience here. I visited a few months ago while on a trip to see my boyfriend and posted a three star review citing that I had a great visit but that Luci's was a lot to take in. They responded by offering me store credit to come back and give them another shot. I really appreciate that they care, and since I don't live in Arizona I was able to give my boyfriend that credit and he said he really enjoyed what he ordered. I'm going to have to come back when I'm in Phoenix in a few months!

4CIRgZMlTAfpfc73vo8Fag.text: I love finding organic places on vacation. Luci's did not disappoint. The coffee and breakfast were awesome. They have a gift shop and it has the best unique items. There is a water feature for small kids outside, it's so cute though can get loud.

b57DPJ8Xl-n-V_J_TjmjFA.text: Stopped by whith the fam a little while ago and been meaning to write my review.   This place is absolutely great for families. It kinda reminds me of a Cracker Barrel, except with more upscale and one of a kind items.   They have fun toys for kids as well as fun gifts for adults. Lots of drink ware and such.   At first you might be a bit taken a back by the higher end prices on tiny toys but I believe they are so unique they are worth it.   The food was delicious. We all had different items. The kids had breakfast even though it was lunch time and hubby and I had burgers. They were a bit dry.  I have to say they really needed flavor. Even on the burnt side for my pattie. I decided to stick to it since we were in a hurry and didn't want to wait for a redo. Everyone else's food was great. It will not keep me from coming back. It might have just been a fluke or an off day. Or different chef. Other than the flavor it could have been full 5 stars.   They have a beautiful garden like outdoors and a tiny splash pad for the kids outside. You really are paying for the ambiance. The location is on the smaller side but plenty of seating outside when it's not burning hot.   We will try it again because it was really nice all around. I'll take more pics then.

_TlvbOdtBsyNylnt3XizfA.text: First time here! We loved it! Great location, layout, and food! We had a great conversation and enjoyed the atmosphere.
