pwLGokK9yac2jCG_YnwvTw.text: Lovely looking property with lots of cute places to sit and enjoy a catch-up with a friend. Crowd is mostly families/middle aged with some younger people mixed in. Lots of kids, especially with the splash pad, open outdoor area, ice cream shop and various kid-friendly toys for sale inside. Staff is great, they are on top of things and seems to usually be the same people so you know they aren't rotating staff a lot which is nice. Wish the ordering process was a little more swift, but it seems like that's on purpose to give each person more personal attention. Just can seem slow if there's a line, so prepare to be patient!

DBmU5XNejctAW4FsXpmkBA.text: We have been to Luci's several times before and it has been excellent food. Today we ordered the same items we always do and we were sorely disappointed. First, the spicy chicken sandwich was extremely dry and had no sauce, and the pasta salad was drowning in Italian dressing. The biscuits on my biscuits and gravy were hard and cold (usually they're light, fluffy and warm) and both the yolks on my eggs were broke when they made it to our table. Regular chef on vacation perhaps?

AmdYPnqNwcgmiWGFi7ZQMQ.text: My 1st time here we had a sit down breakfast seating inside is limited more self serve my girlfriend loved it because it has a store inside I saw a variety of ages here seems very popular music was kind of loud for me patio area looked great but it just rained I like 1st watch better but this place is great for milllenials

PMuHSPLN1rtwQseNszBTQA.text: It's finally here!!! We live within walking distance of The Orchard and frequent the original Luci's a few times a week, so needless to say we've been anxiously anticipating the opening. We've been to Pomelo and are looking forward to trying that again (great pizza, but we were there opening week and I think they were working some kinks out, will review when we go back). Official opening is 6/6, but you can go now. SO here's what you need to know about the new Luci's (assuming you are familiar with the OG):  1) There's the food/bev order station, a juice bar AND a bar (order only, Pomelo has the sit down bar). You no longer have to stand in the main line to order a coffee! They finally have a separate menu for their full range of non-alcoholic drinks and flavors which is AWESOME because I knew there were gems I hadn't tried yet. Watermelon Green Tea is my new Summer jam. The Bloody Mary's are INSANELY good.  2) The food menu is different! I, like you, was wondering how they were going to pull off two Luci's within a mile of each other. Well, they did it!!! Gone are the burrito bomb (RIP for my husband, you'll have to make the extra 3 minute journey if you're really craving it) and Turkey Lurkey, replaced with equally (maybe even more) appetizing Carne Asada burrito and Turkey Melt. We also got the Grinder (looks fabulous), Natural Flavor Burger (in the running for best new burger in Phoenix?), Kid's Chicken Strips (we need to talk about how perfect these fries are), and the Tuna and Fig Wrap for me (more tuna, less greens, and fig pieces in the jam would take this from good to great). I am so excited to explore the menu and find my new favorites. See picture for full menu.  3) The GOODS. Okay, bye bye LGO, cute boutiques, and Luci's OG. They've taken it to the next level with merchandise. This has more consumer products than grocery, but there is an abundance of Danzeisen milk (cow love emojis) in every flavor and size. We're talking gorgeous and unique home styling, bath, gifts, and every day use products. Swell water bottles, Coola sunscreen, stylish mosquito repellent bracelets (yes, I own that statement), blinged out pepper spray, cute kid's gifts. I'm not doing it justice. You'll see.  4) Vibe and decor. SPLASH PAD that you can take an assortment of adult beverages from all 3 restaurants to. We went out to a table in the middle of the orchard on the grass in Phoenix's first 117 day. The umbrella and misters did their job! The baby LOVES the splash pad. Ample seating inside and out (thank goodness ). I love the original elements (fireplace) inside building 2, rocking chairs, spacious layout and I won't go too much more into the overall vibe of The Orchard because this place is now MINE and you don't have to frequent it in order for it to stay in business... I think I'll be keeping it afloat single-handedly. :)  Update: tried the Chilaquiles today and they are SO good! Also, tried the gelato from Splurge. I'm going to wait until they are fully up and running before I review. Initial impressions are that the gelato is in test stages :( - the flavors (green tea and salted caramel) were off and too sugary. Plus, $4 for a single scoop doesn't seem like the right price point considering each add'l scoop is $1. I don't want to be penalized for getting a single scoop. It does, however, promote sharing. Hoping they add affogato/coffee/float options and ready for the adult selections!

qJ9mK8OZJwa7mMG2l4Uj-w.text: We held our daughter's graduation party at Pomelo/ Luci's at the Orchard and were absolutely delighted with the service and food. Linda helped us plan the party and was extremely helpful, working with us every step of the way to meet our needs! The front patio worked out great for us and was beautiful with its fireplace and lights in the trees. Our guests had a wonderful time and most remarked at what a beautiful restaurant this is and how good the food was. We will definitely hold another party at Pomelo in the future! Thank you again Linda for all your guidance & great ideas!

TEAaHYk1Mwu1X6b4XF-HGA.text: Pretty good restaurant & lovely atmosphere. Their coffee is tasty and service is always quick (even with long lines).

yVi8dII4GrmjRqCHF6ZboQ.text: I absolutely love this place! The food and the service is amazing. Perfect spot for brunch with your girlfriends or mom. They have something on the menu for everyone. Everything was very fresh and cooked to perfection. They have a great selection of beverages including alcoholic and non- alcoholic drinks. I had the biscuits and gravy along with a Bloody Mary, I enjoyed both. I will definitely be back.

PkIE6pw7rgwvdOUMmYpg7A.text: My girlfriends and I came here for brunch. It was our first time and we absolutely LOVED everything about this place. It is so cute, is next to an ice cream shop, the food is amazing, kid friendly, and overall AMAZING! I ordered the Rueben Stack (it was, AMAZING!) SQZPAAXuQnMp1DoUGiIjyQ.text: We've ordered burrito bombs and had uber eats deliver. Each time, I specifically say NO potatoes - how difficult is that - they still put potatoes in - ruined it for us every time. Never again will we order from there!

jP60zZ-dd-4wF-S5fusv2w.text: *Almost* cannot even focus on the menu when I walked into the store. Everything is so quaint and adorable and there's so much to look at!  What made it even harder was my toddler son who had the same problem as I did; he wanted to touch everything!  Anyhow- we needed food and chose the kids meal chicken and the reg menu crispy chicken sandwhich.  Both were delicious and I really wanted to snag a picture of my plate...... but I was too hungry and forgot.  Paid about $18 for our meals and it took everything in me to pass up the giant cookies that were sitting in the display case. But I will not pass it up next time!

Y_eApYS3CIEXFLou57sxZA.text: We came late morning and decided to try lunch. I love enjoy their chai and other teas, but the food experience was a miss. I ordered a chef salad type entree, and I couldn't eat much of it. The bacon on top was chewy, creeped me out, and the salad had been just doused in a ranch dressing. It was legit soaking! We also tried what I felt was a lackluster burger which seemed like a dish to try judging their other reviews on the same.

6g9OG-sDkdCmlKqqFNlqlw.text: This place had me from the outside - absolutely gorgeous manicured grounds with outdoor seating, a small splashpad for kiddos, and shade galore. What a beautiful spot. But, the unfriendly service, lack of available product for breakfast, dry unpalatable scones, and atrocious flies put me off. I am especially glad I'm not allergic to nut products ... I ordered a chocolate smoothie and took a few sips only to find it was loaded with peanut or almond butter. That was a big surprise - not chocolate at all. And nowhere did it state that nut butter would be added. Staff needs some training in customer relations, friendliness, and food preparation. BTW - only one bathroom per gender and it's way too crowded for that. There are many other cute places throughout the valley to meet up for breakfast.

2Wix0SUpLmkuvYu-m3EuaQ.text: This place was way too ridiculously crowded. You should avoid on weekends. It is really a great space- 5 stars for the concept but there is no place to park and it took 20 minutes on line to order food. I guess this is a weekday, go early, type of place. Maybe over the summer when places are dead but then it would be way too hot.

zjWfudfkVcaCgNiBy0xAbg.text: "Oh Boy!" *mickey mouse voice*. I love love love this little breakfast all day, lunch durning lunch eatery! Reminds me of crackle barrel a bit because of the cute little toys and gadgets surrounding the waiting and dining area. Drove a whopping 30 miles for this magical place (I have the little wretch light on my car saying I need an oil change but that didn't stop me) #noregrets #getthechipotleaiolewiththeclub

LIbsm09-w2Nr7j4g7wiNLw.text: Came here with a group a few weeks ago.  We sat outside.  It was so beautiful and charming.  The service was great.  The food was good.  The only reason I didn't put five stars is the coffee tasted terrible to me.  But I will definitely come back and enjoy the atmosphere, especially in good weather when I can sit out by the trees.  I agree with the other customer about the kids.  I couldn't find a quiet spot.

lrY11Susv_m5Av6GRBkBVQ.text: This is my go-to spot in the morning. I usually hit this place before work for a chocolate protein smoothie! The barista's are very knowledgeable and helpful! Especially when it comes to customizing my protein smoothie in the morning since I log everything into MyFitnessPal. It tends to get very crowded around lunch time during the week so I suggest you either order ahead or expect a wait. They also have a splash pad for the little ones which is a plus and an ice cream desert bar in the  back! This is a beautiful place to eat outside when the weather is right! I definitely recommend coming here and trying it for yourself!

V2k7UcouZVrTbFzqeI1XHg.text: Came here for lunch for the first time with a friend and our little ones. I got the sweet fig and tuna wrap and cheese crisp with fries. The cheese crisp and fries were a hit with the little one! I loved the outdoor seating and how kid friendly it was. It's hard going out to eat with an active 14 month old so it was a nice change!! Would like to go back to try the other places at the orchard!

DM9nvTtytShFFs0b-CoWag.text: Amazing food, and such a fun environment!!!  I want to eat everything on the menu We drive for 30 minutes just for their delicious food. The kids have fun shopping for unexpected treasures too lol

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A favorite spot to bring friends
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast is to die for!

WYQcIj-GgqpgIPn0-_Aatg.text: This place is so dang adorable.   We stopped in after a sunrise hike up Piestewa, so it was pretty early on a holiday. There were plenty of seats outside under the shade during that time, but I can imagine it would get busy on a weekend late morning.   I ordered a breakfast sammy and an iced tea from the front counter. Grabbed my iced tea and went to sit at a table outside, where our meals were delivered. Wow, those sammies were MUCH bigger than I expected. I got mine with an everything bagel, cheddar, and bacon. SO good and very filling.   Lots of little kids, a handful of mellow pups, and it's lovely. I can't wait to return with my son.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thicc breakfast sammy

daVP9ReAHOUTTpDVzp2iTA.text: Great find! Stopped in for lunch and marveled at this cute place. Mid-block so don't pass it up by accident like I did. Located among many established shade trees. Lots of seating indoor and out. Things to look at with cute merchandise everywhere, mostly for the kiddos.  Order Luci Burger (provolone cheese and bacon not onion) with pasta salad. They brought to my table in pretty good time considering how busy this place is. Clearly a local favorite. The food was good. Burger was juicy, brioche bun as a tad dry on the edges but altogether an enjoyable meal.  Visited the candy/ice cream area for two scoops (chocolate and butter pecan with little M&Ms) of yummy delight!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lots of interesting merchandise
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ice cream
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Helpful ice cream staffer

fk7XFadIDjH8rNIPGTnjGQ.text: Order breakfast at the walk up counter, get a number, find a seat. Enjoy.  The place is kinda a wi-fi cafe, a gift shop, a coffee joint, a breakfast/brunch spot, there's even a little splash pad for the kids.   The French toast was wonderful! I saw a huge variety of muffins and breakfast rolls that would be perfect to grab for the office or to take to a friends. Abundant outdoor seating. A shareable library.  Healthy food. A few gluten free choices. I would not recommend it for large parties. But I would imagine for brunch or busy holidays you'll need to get there right at opening, they don't take reservations.  There's parking on the sides so if you pull up and it looks full just check the corners.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M-3zScW-_49ft7sJYMl2mw.text: What a gem. I live around 4 min away from here. This is a fantastic place to have a healthy breakfast or lunch, with conscious options and fresh squeezed juices. The place is an old ranch, there's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. People were using their laptops and there were plenty of family having an enjoyable time. This place is great for everyone to do their own thing at a leisurely pace.   My breakfast burrito came with egg whites, kale, mushrooms. It was flavorful. The best was their salsa. It was perfect. It had a fantastic balance of smoky tomatoes and peppers.   I would certainly come here again. Next time I know I'm gonna get one of their juices. You should give it a try too.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K92yszj2c1jrRUkKVn-BxA.text: How cute is this place! I love the little shop, fun activities for my nephew (splash fountain!) and dog friendly, too. There's a couple restaurant type choices and an ice cream shop, too.

AW0AWMn7Z2Mb2vc3qhS_Vw.text: Fun cute place to eat.  I really appreciate the healthy choices and variety on the menu.  It's so nice to have several gluten free breakfast items like flapjacks and French toast.  I ordered the breakfast frittata and my friend ordered the acai bowl and the egg Sammie.  There are cute areas to eat outside under the tent with chandeliers or at tables with umbrellas.  I opted to eat inside due to the 110 heat.  This a nice place local place to eat in a nice relaxed atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I3iKa5seL6F2BeaMUmdgJw.text: It's a compound. Much like the Apple Farm in San Luis Obispo, California only without the motel and it's more hipster Scottsdale and Arcadia adjacent.   The restaurant is decent, the outdoor party area is quaint and the cafe/coffee/boutique/candy/ice cream is a busy conundrum hopped up on coffee and privilege. They need to work on the menu and offer better pastry...  Where else can you get decent fare, trinkets and determine "if Botox is right for you?" Lucy's (also by this owner) and La Grande Orange (LGO) are absolutely inspired by Santa Monica/Pasadena/Wilshire corridor for those of you from LA.

zAHfCgWEYDfDeicKz1s2lw.text: I went to this restaurant omg the food is so good I highly recommend this restaurant The employees were really friendly they have a good customer service

EiP-memwnH7XrIhAMEaksQ.text: I love this place! The first thing I noticed was the beautiful and private courtyard surrounded by greenery and the ample seating! I came for brunch and ordered the Spaniard omelette for ~$11. You order at the counter and seat yourself. While waiting for my food, I browsed the many fun items in the store- you can find very fun gifts here!   The omelette was delicious, but I surprisingly loved the side seasoned potatoes more! Overall, I would order it again!   I love the ambience here. It's very family friendly, and great for any event!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Open seating area

YOXhPzO1UmUBtupytfFVww.text: I have to update ! Still love this place ! Even had the manager reach out to me after my last visit ! You can tell they really value their customers ! Everyone is always so friendly and nice ! With this I have to stay I would so much rather pay $5 for a good muffin and amazing friendly people than  $2 for an alright muffin and crappy people! Tonight I tried their oatmeal pie for the first time  umm May be back tomorrow for a few more ! It is on point with just enough crisp / softness and sweetness ! Great job !! Amazing ness in your mouth !

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal pie , heaven in my mouth

TiSAMMJTsjRF296E6B3R1A.text: I love Luci's at 16th Street and Bethany Home Road, but this might be my new favorite. I love the courtyard/outdoor seating, the burrito bomb for breakfast, and a cup of hot coffee.  We had our holiday party here last year in the covered/tent area and we had a great time. The ice cream is delicious, the food was yummy, and being outdoors for a more relaxed holiday party was fun too.

3uftDc_ApCMV-t8yUXYRJg.text: I tried luci's at the Orchard, was not impressed with there food at all. I'm a complete foodie and breakfast items and lunch items are so bland that they need to take a course from some new York chefs to be taught what excellence in dining stems from. Infuse decent flavors into your coffee, Ice cream & all your entrees and hire warm welcoming people personnel so patrons will want to come again and thoroughly enjoy the ambiance, because until you has a restauranteur can achieve that I won't be patronizing luci's at the Orchard again

0jcw8foUrETMsbkMYziRSg.text: Beautiful place and space. Had the burrito bomb with chicken chorizo and cheddar cheese. Had an iced cold brew. Food was good, but felt like it was overpriced. I feel like I'm paying more for the ambiance.

yISYooLvIlzYdn1sWMWE-w.text: I wish I could give higher stars to your place and will absolutely give you 5 stars if this issue is dealt with:   Your coffee.   I have gone twice in the last month in hopes that maybe it was the barista but my husband and I both poured our lattes out because they were so bad. Both times. We even tried black coffee with a little almond milk and it was really bad too.   We usually get almond milk lattes at surrounding coffee shops and they are just fine, but this is the only coffee shop where it is just really bad.  The ambiance and everything you have done with the place is amazing and I would go all the time to hang out but I want to have a good coffee when I do!

yNqP2_gw2dGGTBdI4BGA2A.text: Walked in for Sunday brunch and seated immediately despite a fairly full patio with a couple private events going on. We were looking for a shaded patio for good food in Glendale and we found it! Our server Nicole was friendly and quick. Patio has misters and a large grassy area for kids to play. As long as you don't mind the little ones running around this is a great place to host a brunch. Also $8 signature cocktails, can't beat it!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional breakfast and fried chicken sandwich
Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Giant warm cinnamon roll

ZiVeXqcSxjoHyREf18uiqQ.text: This place gets a 3.5-4 star because the overall experience was fine. Their specific outdoor space is casual and nothing too fancy. They share the space with 3-4 other venues which is a bit odd. The space behind us was pretty dirty and was a covered with a dirty white tent and had propane tanks and cords everywhere.   The food at Luci's was all very tasty. We got the albacore tuna wrap which was just canned tuna but the fig sauce made it lovely. We also got the chopped cob salad with chicken on the side. The chicken kind of ruined this for me because the salad was so good, but the chicken came right from a can. Not sure if they don't have a grill or what - but wasn't expecting that!  Arnold Palmer is bomb and one of the best in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iwr83Wtm2a4jiSelNQTgsA.text: Found this little hidden gem while up in north Phoenix waiting for a store to open. It was so cute... the ambience and the seating in the patio was so nice and relaxing. They have a splash pad for kids to run around in since it's so hot here! The food was excellent... it was busy so you know the place is great since it was 8:30 am! There is a cute store attached to area where you order and they also serve beer, wine and alcohol ! I can't wait to go back ... it is not close for me but every once in a while I am sure I will make the drive. They also have a cute area for parties, small weddings etc that has gorgeous chandeliers.

WI-NueL7AfENCQ7d4yR7XA.text: This place is super cute. Loved the burrito bomb. "The orchard" juice was really good. Loved the chocolate muffin and cheese danish. Loved the concept of this place, a little pricey but worth the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrito Bomb

rDdrDf6UPMUMuR62iX_H7g.text: I love walking here when I visit my grandma in Phoenix. It's a great place for breakfast and the knickknacks that are sold throughout the store are so cute and quirky! The omelettes, pancakes, and parfaits are all really delicious. There is a water feature out on the porch that all the little kiddos play in, which is adorable to watch. It never fails that there is a group of mommies sipping on mimosas while their kids have the time of their lives in the water. Great, playful atmosphere. I'll always come here when I'm in town!

IZJo9P99QccWNHm18tgajw.text: I met a friend last week for lunch at Luci's at the Orchard. It was a very cool setting and seems like it is super kid friendly with the outdoor splash pad. The food was great. My only complaint was most of the seating was outdoors. We found a spot inside and it was pretty stuffy. To be fair, they probably couldn't do anything about this due to the AZ extreme summer heat! Overall, I recommend Luci's at the Orchard! Very cool I lace!

agciWHOdx7d2BbpKJ4jyWA.text: This was my second time giving this place a try because the first time was not good either. I ordered a kids French toast and the lady tried changing me for the regular French toast so I had to correct her about the cost. I understand that breakfast places can be expensive but this place is definitely overpriced on everything. The atmosphere is really cute but the price and attitude of the workers are not worth it.

ni5DH_DpPNY4OjZCLTt-YA.text: Fabulous food, amazing atmosphere and phenomenal service!  I highly recommend the Reuben sandwich and grass organic beef hamburger

FuN-4_W6s1ClK37yltgbeQ.text: I love the variety and uniqueness of this place. I've been back multiple times and love the many food options and the coffee is awesome! The indoor seating is as lovely as the outdoor seating! Great place to hang out and eat good food. Bonus: they have a splash pad for the kids during the oh so lovely AZ summers.

RfyDl6iNjC4eUcui9bRz9Q.text: I love this place but they really need to get some wine to serve.  Only having Pinot Noir for your red wine is not working for me.  Add a merlot, (especially if it is from Washington) . Good wine sells.  I love the outdoor concept and this will only get better with the better weather.  The folks who work here make the place the best.  The gelato server is a True asset as is the entire staff including the dishwasher who poked his head out and tried to help because it was busy.  Bravo for finding people who enjoy where they work - it shows.  I hated taking a star away but until you have some wine by the glass selection....

KYtX5G6-c1SCFrdV3_SxhA.text: I came to this place for the first time recently and I love it! I love the outdoor space - so green, friendly and inviting. It was fun to shop all the knickknacks while I waited for my friend. The baked treats look amazing, though I haven't tried them yet.  But, not exaggerating, the iced chai tea I got was one of the best I've ever had, because it wasn't too sweet! Instead it was just really flavorful and a little sweet. Perfection.   I'll be back!

tskTxSgjplfs3KVkZJOzHQ.text: This place gets an A for simply presentation! Awesome feel good spot! Haven't had their food yet but I'm in such a good mood that I can have cup'a noodlez and Love it!

bOWBOYZWob62wy0SbS7l1g.text: Had a nice breakfast of eggs. Good ambience, nice staff, good food over all. Blanco Verde and Spaniard omelettes we're awesome. Good tasty food.

Bxu1ZDz1TKLCX50LSGbkqw.text: Hands down my fav place to go!! So glad they opened a second location at the orchard. It's perfect!!

5Icq6lT-WaRLtyVUVbFRWA.text: Absolutely love it here. I come here all the time to get away and just focus on any work I have to get done.

VPk1hukAe4PlcnZ_fOL4dA.text: Love love love this new location! It's spacious and fun for the whole family. It fit the bill when we needed to meet up w friends that have young kids due to the splash pad. I got juice and the tuna wrap. Really hit the spot!

Z-8lxMiTiLdZE54BhHPD8w.text: Unreal facilities that will impress any party or business meeting.  The entire venue was built with character, history and sentimental value in everything designed.  Great outdoor seating, restaurant, bar, menu and service.  Go here for a great time or to impress friends/business.

etNSZ8td9yUXcTrmtLa0eA.text: The only thing this restaurant has going for them is the outdoor patio. Honestly, the employees are grouchy only one guy who works there (African American guy is the only one who ever smiles and appears to enjoy their job.), the food is never consistent and the prices are ridiculous. We have been coming here since they opened, about once every two weeks. It's literally never the same everytime we come. The portions are all over the place, the baked goods (from outside vendors are also not consistent) and people just generally seem grouchy. I get it's early and it's a weekend but I do not want my $5 SIDE of bacon to be cold, hard and overcooked unless I ask for it that way. Also when you walk it up front and ask the grouchy girl for new side and the cooks are all mad and making remarks that's inappropriate. The place isn't cheap, you can't get out of there with two medium portioned breakfasts and two drinks for under $40. The outdoor area is great for parties and kids (they have a splash pad), but if you hate your job and can't smile then probably just quit. Ps we ONLY  go back because my boyfriend likes the cinnamon rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DWMa2mNNTTCyVR5-QzddXw.text: My Birthday brunch!  First visit to the Orchard location. Same great service and gift shop. The menu is a little different but delicious. I had the Cheddar Biscuits and mushroom gravy, really elevated version of a breakfast classic.   If you love Luci's on Bethany Home Road, then you'll love Luci's at the Orchard!

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s my Birthday .  Excellent Cheddar Biscuits and mushroom gravy!

rSbx1C_9OY3tPS78IK1ikg.text: We often come here for the splash pad and inevitably end up with coffee's, or ice cream or end up staying for dinner! A lovely spot!

N1KkK2YUNdLQobnR1AOlaw.text: I had breakfast here on opening day and it was such a delight. The food, the service, the views, the atmosphere - everything was great. More spacious than the original Luci's on Bethany Home and 16th Street and with definitely more parking (a challenge in the original establishment). The menu is different at this new location but you can still find some of the favorite items from the original Luci's. Also, there is a lot of outdoor patio seating and very nice views of the green space in the middle of the Orchard complex.  Prices are really good, many colorful gift items are for sale, and WiFi is available.

Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the comfortable, casual dining spaces.

SOr_uKLP_Y_GjvbIIxsN7Q.text: We have been to Lucis several times but today was not a great experience.  1.   Stood in line from the door because they were only running 1 cashier.  2.  Couldn't find the paper menus because by the time you get to the cashier you can't see the menus. 3.  Ordered the special sammie and it was $10.49, one of the most expensive items on the menu.  It literally was the most over priced item and lacked value. No side of any kind compared to other menu items it was a huge disappointment especially at Luke warm temperature.  4.  Traditional breakfast, eggs cold and potatoes luke warm at best.

qu7v4AYc1lvL7bjs59-OcQ.text: Central Phoenix asked & Luci's Urban Concepts answered in spades.   Luci's at the Orchard is an incredible property, fit for just about anyone. The counter service restaurant offers great customer service and incredible food that leans more toward really-freakin-well-done comfort food than Luci's Healthy Marketplace @ 16th/Bethany. They do have salads -I hear- but I can't take a break eating the French toast and chicken sandwich to find out.   Also found within the Luci's space at the Orchard is a retail market with adorable trinkets, perfect gifts and plenty of other odds and ends you'll just have to have. There's a fully stocked bar with beer, liquor and wine in the middle and can't forget Splurge- the sweet little gelato shop. Try the "Mint to be for Nick" flavor, it's super good and is named in honor of a local boy fighting a terminal illness.   You'll be hard pressed to find a better patio in Uptown. The Splashpad & surrounding tables is a great space for little ones and their families while the front porch & accompanying rocking chairs  are perfect for a quiet escape.

yZkOR__fW5li_-E9Xw8NnQ.text: This spot is adorable! I went the first time a few weeks ago and have already been back a few times.   Their coffee is delicious and made quickly even when the lines are long. I've had their corned beef eggs Benedict and I'm in love. So yum! I love the little shop inside, so many unique items. My 1yr old can spend hours at their splash pad. The relaxed atmosphere is refreshing. I've never felt rushed, everyone seems to be relaxed. It's a great place to go when I don't have to keep an eye on time, and just want a safe fun place for me and my baby to hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple sweet splash pad.

Fi-2Nd4hVmIZGG_tQsgNZA.text: Cute place to order at the counter and eat outside on their adorable patio. Super family-friendly - Luci's includes an indoor market and an outdoor splash pad. Affordable prices. Pretty good food: I enjoyed the French toast and the breakfast sandwich, but the breakfast burrito was just kinda bland and the skirt steak was alternately tough and fatty. The green tea smoothie is delicious, however.  Overall, I would go back, even if just to hang out and drink a smoothie and eat a muffin.

jJRa9AmS8CNuSge8HP7KVw.text: I was excited to come here as this seemed like such a great concept. I got my 2 year old all jazzed up for the splash pad. Truth be told, getting some drinks and treats for the adults, and using the splash pad was really our primary reason for coming to check this place out. We arrived at 3:15p on Saturday.....to a closed splash pad. Try explaining that to a 2 Year old. Disappointed :( Don't know if we will return again. I had such high hopes and feel bummed

wEJiPt9xyIkCAZecbf2O0w.text: Great place to go and hang out for an afternoon alone to study or even to hang out with friends! Food has always been amazing and the merchandise is worth the time to look over!

u6-xiS0Yz7yJ7MZqaJrf4A.text: Had such high expectations from all the recommendations I got to try this place. I must say that I didn't see what the hype was all about after my visit. We ordered the traditional breakfast and build your own omelet. For starters, the toast was burnt and the eggs weren't cook as ordered. The hash browns, eggs, and omelet needed some serious seasoning. I ordered bacon and ham in my omelet, but if they were there they were masters of disguise. The person that brought our food was helpful, but nothing to rave about. She got us non-burnt toast, scrambled eggs, and jelly. Nevertheless, we won't be returning anytime soon. For the price paid I expected more, could've got better tasting food somewhere else.

HzhFZJnKU2U_kbMnXWC30g.text: This past weekend, we celebrated my Dad's 90th Birthday party at Luci's!  The staff did a fantastic job!  Specials thanks to Linda and Serg!  You guys did a wonderful Job, you went beyond our expectations!  The food was delicious!  Our guests said it was the best pork chops and halibut they have ever eaten.  Your servers were wonderful, so attentive to our guests needs.  I would highly recommend planning your next family/friends event at Luci's!  You won't be disappointed!

mPSlv6ZGSDF--CBKyTCIYQ.text: Ambiance is wonderful however brunch on weekends can be a little disjointed. It's going to be crowded. If you want an alcoholic drink, it can't be ordered where you order your food so you end up standing in 2 separate lines. I also really wish they'd put a turkey burger or veggie burger (preferably both) on the menu.

ov5gVgz7T_WJh7a3onzSQA.text: We live in the neighborhood. Love the ambience. Great local breakfast place within walking distance. I only give it 3 stars because the coffee is weak and not of coffee house quality. We asked if they served dark roast and the girls said we have a dark roast and a light roast. I asked for two large dark roasts. The dark roast was a medium roast at best. Starbucks dark roast is worth the mile drive and then go the Lucy's for breakfast. I hope this changes. I'd love to walk down the street for a great cup of coffee. But until then I'll drive to Starbucks or LuX.

9Uw6SLtW3oYY7d5s1w8wBQ.text: smarter version of lagrande orange....dig the vibe.....been craving crepes for far too long. check.

Bj9xhsC0oQzn8ELwoBHKzw.text: This was my first time here and was impressed! Excellent selection on the menu and the food was excellent! ! Had the Orchard omelet, it was yummmmmmy! Definitely will be back

UVZwwTK8l9QP0JzdxJYKgA.text: We went for lunch today. Everything was delicious and fresh.  The ambiance is clean and cool. The staff was attentive and friendly. I can't wait to go back when it's cooler so we can sit outside.

EIaWGLU11zF8872xnykr3Q.text: We are thrilled to have a place like this open in our neighborhood. Great food and great place to come hangout with the kids. They have fantastic outdoor area with nice little splash pad and seating areas with misters. Ice cream is amazing. Love it here. Only bummer is that the splash pad closes at 6 on weekends, but stays open until 8 on weekdays.

fzWG5rrPcjXaKjs-EKb1UA.text: I really wanted to love the new location, and was willing to put previous poor food and service at the original location aside. While the concept is lovely, the omelette was awful. The applewood smoked bacon was so over cooked, I was unable to stick my fork in it. Overall, the omelette was slightly burnt. I hope they can fix this issue!

owpXW2SwW_etOoldxw0Ywg.text: I love this place. Perfect for small children. Very child friendly, big open lawn and splash pad. The smoothies and teas are good too. I don't drink coffee, but I come here frequently with my daughter.

z187CUeyHPLxHUJabJY0bQ.text: The staff was immediately attentive and helpful with a recommendation for my breakfast choice.  The entire restaurant, inside and out, was impeccably clean.  Their coffee has a very full flavor profile which complimented my Orchard omelette, to which I added chicken breast.  The meal was incredibly delicious.  I recommend Luci's to anyone looking for a delicious meal in a casual, family friendly, dining environment.

TJbIy_yGZhyYFbz6AMUWpw.text: I wanted to like this place I love the setting it's in my neighborhood but the food is just so so and it's way overpriced

EE8XBz4OXtZ5RpKlK0ROtw.text: AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE!!! Everything is clean paying for my food is quick and the delivery of food is quick! The drinks are phenomenal.  The atmosphere is relaxing and Toni is so friendly :)

izfykiNwi9hZuMZ3DQRLoQ.text: Sorry  But $13.00 for two SMALL iced coffees is stupid expensive !!      Who the .... do they think they are ?  Don't mind paying for good things but this plain offended me  Never going back

F2tq7heYOGHYrcUbniRLBQ.text: The food was about par, but a little pricey. I was charged 50 extra for a little butter for my bagel and an extra $1 for strawberry flavor for my lemonade. $11 for a lemonade and bagel doesn't make me want to return for a full meal.

Pka_q8VpAN9d1Uu2AJWb1Q.text: Rude & snobby counter staff, aggressive table hoarding by other patrons, poorly executed food (please actually toast the bagels & serve the food while its hot), dirty dishes & silverware with servers who refuse to acknowledge that truth ... No thank you.  Such a pretty place - wish the managers had better control of the situation.

FOcXuLogGPAQV6dibkEyVg.text: As someone who really loves Luci's, I want to give Luci's at the Orchard 4-5 stars.  However, the issue is that every time I have been there, usually mid-afternoon, there is always a group of parents with small children in the "grassy" area CHANGING DIRTY DIAPERS NEXT TO TABLES THAT PEOPLE ARE EATING AT.     As a healthcare professional, this is a SERIOUS health code violation for the exact same reason that dogs are not allowed at this restaurant.   This is an outdoor area set up with tables for people to eat at. The "grassy" area is not real grass but faux turf/green carpet making it an absolute BREEDING GROUND FOR BACTERIA.  There are lovely bathrooms with changing tables not 50 feet away from the grassy area.  Hopefully, Luci's management takes this seriously and gets this issue fixed before 1) they get shut down by the health department, or 2) someone gets sick.

h1vheJn162e2q85UNpFHKA.text: Great pancakes! Fun place to take little ones so they can run around while you eat and sip coffee.

MX3jvfgNy74AqQEs5DESQA.text: Great setting; customer service could be better.  Third time to this location.  Counter help friendly, but it's kind of gross to see someone who is going to be touching your plate when they deliver your food or get your drink be playing with their hair or repeatedly wiping their nose.  Today when the plates were cleared, she knocked my leftover container onto the ground, flipping it over and opening it.  She picked it up and asked "Is this still okay to you?"  I said, NO, you can take it. She piled it onto the stack of plates and left -no offer of a drink, or dessert or anything.  Even a sincere sorry would have been expected.

0Oqmis7eGdLAvof0AQbEEA.text: Yummy yum yum.  Enjoyed a lovely lunch on the patio and some good convo with a friend.  Service was spot on and loved being able to shop all the non edible goodies!

uLnh-2cuZHavCvFyNB02Qw.text: Just like Luci's on Bethany, but tucked away in a cute little area. Good food, drinks, and other cool stuff. Parking is extremely limited.

amOD-xiQwYtIYb9rA9Ruhg.text: Stopped in here for breakfast on an early Sunday morning before a spring training game. It was almost full when we got here but the line was out the door when we left. So get here early! The orchard omelette was very good. Eggs were neither dry nor undercooked. The bagel and lox were average and I wouldn't get them again. We enjoyed the excellent coffee and juice on the well shaded patio. We'll definitely stop by again on a return trip.

zNCHKuAYOKF6mRR3trkhKw.text: I really wanted to try this place.  It was very crowded with a long line to order.  Luckily we found a table for the four of us.  It took a long time to get our orders, but since it was so busy, I did not worry about it.  They gave us a number to put on the table.  We saw the servers walking around the restaurant both inside and out holding plates of food looking for the number associated with the order.  It was no surprise when we saw them take please outside and search and then walk inside still looking.  I was not surprised when our breakfasts came to the table with cold food.  I must say $10 for the traditional breakfast is way too much for such a small mediocre plate of food.  The atmosphere was very family oriented.  Lots of babies and dogs. Beautiful weather and pleasant tables to meet with family and friends.

OpTWEnEdGLEmURh0FSL5mA.text: We tried to have a large group of people come to the restaurant (people that tend to eat and drink a lot btw) and we were hit with this. Not what I would expect from a business like this. Limited menu, no split checks, $100 'service fee' on top of a 20% tip AND eating underground?!  Might want to change your policies.

d1Sh7IQNPsAF1R0d8H6_0g.text: My good friend Sam and I went here for lunch. Service couldn't have been better. The food was delicious. The surroundings were exceptional. Sam knows the best places to lunch. Must go back and try more of their large menu. The calamari was a perfect started. Sam got a turkey sandwich and I had a salad. Absolutely delicious.

i5dUjRVkB6t-peiuCGU6hQ.text: This place is delicious!! The coffee is amazing!Awesome place to come hang out with friends and family in the yard.

PTccRSmeFCTeYXismQrK9g.text: This might be my favorite place in Phoenix. As a long time fan of Luci's healthy marketplace, I had high expectations for the Orchard and they were completely surpassed. The location is like no other in Phoenix, it is instantly charming inside and out. I usually go there during the weekends for brunch, but have visited at all times of day. The menu is great and I've loved everything I've tried, great place to hang out on the weekends or work during the week. Definitely check this place out at some point.

jVCBBsineNVRooPwOSJPqg.text: One of my favourite places in Phoenix. Great outside area, amazing food, and incredible service anytime you go.

ogm5QvTgJM7ByipTzellrQ.text: Wow. Sorry for not knowing what your menu items are exactly. Not like you have a sign for the drive thru. Thanks for the yummy coffee Michelle. You were not friendly or inviting at all. I went off the name on the receipt because you didn't give me one. Had a feeling you were the manager because you are of a more mature stature but you definitely didn't present yourself as someone who likes what your doing. Hope your day gets better. Like that Luci's  is down the street from me but will be going to Dutch bros from now on.

XGnQaAYYp6EfPlsRGYfkDQ.text: It was a little pricey but breakfast was excellent. Visiting from NY.  Great atmosphere. They have a little "gift shop" area and I wish it was stocked with local stuff but sadly mostly made in China. I'm always surprised by places that go the distance to create an amazing selection of perfectly created foods but don't take the time to do the same with stuff they sell. Oh well. I wasn't there to shop, just eat so they get 5 Stars.

DzK65SQoyggwmPGDAPzlzA.text: Went this morning to take my daughter out for breakfast we did have a breakfast burrito that was just fine we also order  Mamosa's.  The  actual measurements for a Mamosa is 4 ounces of champagne and  2 ounces of orange juice,  it was served in a wineglass, which was fine, acceptable my daughter and I probably figured they may have been 2 1/2 to 3 ounces total!  We had to ask for ice so we could add it hoping to make it last more than five minutes LOL people behind the counter didn't seem too happy about that!  I understand your a family hotspot but if you're advertising that you do have beer and wine and champagne you need to step it up!

-ioQcXjxtkxfHnLF1WURNQ.text: The setting is outstanding. The soup exceptional. The burger good but needed seasonings. The toppings for the burger was lacking. The fruit side so-so. Certainly for fast casual this is a place worthy of your consideration.

jYlyyfpSp2ggP2goqKaxlw.text: Love the location and the patio area of this place. Good is good. Drinks are good. Love the splash pad for my kid. And the associates are friendly.   Operations have gone downhill. We used to come last year almost every other Saturday and had no problem.  Now, on Saturdays and Sundays (at least), be prepared to wait 30 minutes to order your food/drinks with lines out the door. Management does not seem to know how to staff for high volume times because they have 1 person taking orders and 1 person making coffee/tea drinks. With the amount of people you have coming through those doors, 1 more cashier and 1 more barista would make the flow thru so much better and your people while already wonderful would have far less stress.  MOMS and DADS... please be aware that you cannot change your children outside anymore for the splash pad unless you want to be embarrassed by management. I was changing my kiddo (which I've done MANY times before at the Orchard) on my own personal blanket in the grass and a manager ran up to me and reached out a hand to cover my child's nether regions (did not actually touch it) and let me know that this was part of the dining room and that we could not change kids outside. They do let dogs inside the building which I also thought wasn't allowed... but...   This manager in general was not very friendly when we had an interaction inside either so maybe it's just him.  All this to say that we probably still will come to the Orchard occasionally because it's the only splash pad that is relatively close to home and I love the Passport green tea and patio but things arent as great as they used to be which could be easily fixed.

Gkt-S5nWm9ZU4kk4Gg8rQA.text: Lunch at Lucy's is great, sitting outside is fun , especially with wonderful Phoenix weather. I had their Green Chile Burger, uninspiring, green Chile, from a can, almost no taste. I would expect Hatch Green Chile at a place like this, potato salad is very good.  Breakfast here is so much better!

AJSoyoYaddwLkcj3rTtq2A.text: Luci's is a wonderful place to take the kids and relax. The atmosphere is very relaxed and the food is really great. Ken and Luci the owners are incredibly gracious humans

qkb2TIUNOKEJW26tXcgNVQ.text: I love the new additional Luci's!!! It's not crowded, plenty of parking, lots of seats and tables, big patio and yard and the food is delightful!!! I wasn't a big fan of the original Luci's on Bethany Home and 16th St because it was stressful to even dine there for the limited parking, long lines and limited seats, but this one is a complete 180!  They have a different menu then the original and the food is so much better too!! I had the chilaquiles and hubby had the crepes. The chilaquiles had the perfect crunch, chunks of avocado and a generous portion of chicken and eggs! The crepes wasn't too sweet and very fluffy. I loved every bite I had.   I'll be visiting often especially when the weather starts cooling down.

eLeqMQrlYlS745_-PHwigA.text: My family and I love this place. I would give it five stars, except that recently they are having private functions and closing down the courtyard a lot. I have now developed the habit of calling over there first to see if they're having a function before taking my family over there and seeing the disappointment on my children's faces whenever the majority of, and sometimes the entire place, is closed to the public. Other than that, I highly recommend this place to everyone. It's a hidden gem.

ML3wowd9ZTrNMh6V7Q45Lw.text: Worst experience ever.   Came here with my dog to have brunch on the patio.    And a worker cane up to our table and threw hot soapy water and told us that we needed to move!

mt94Xs6sWsae7EMhd4V6bQ.text: I tried Luci's at the Orchard for the first time last week.  I drive by it often. I was running early for work, which is extremely rare...  I decided to stop in.  I parked behind the buildings and followed the signs to the front shop.  There are a couple other shops on the same property.  The inside of the store is pretty cool.  I ordered my go-to, almond milk latte.  The employees seemed a little rush and kept conversations to a minimum,  so I opted not to ask for a pastry recommendation. The latte was subpar, so I was a little disappointed by my entire trip.  I think I will try giving them another chance in the future.

-eiPRHn2KMlnoMIGbQnhVg.text: Came here for brunch with my friend.. line was ridiculously long but moved quickly. Which was great. Loved the cute set up inside and out. Lots of seating area outside and the day was amazing. Couldn't decide on what to order but went for some hotcakes and chilaquiles. Hotcakes were amazing and buttery. Chilaquiles.. the green chili sauce was bland and avocado old. My friend ordered corned beef and it was amazing!

Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot cakes

9zfpkPaajl9jVYM9gAc4Pw.text: Finally made it here! I have been meaning to try this place for awhile now but every time I tried they were super busy. We came on a Monday morning around nine and it was not too busy at all. I ordered the corned beef eggs Benedict and an iced vanilla latte. OMG the eggs Benedict was so.good. The English muffin tasted homemade, the cilantro hollandaise sauce was so flavorful, and it had tons of corned beef piled on top. I loved it. The potatoes on the side were also good. My vanilla latte was great also. The best part about Luci's definitelyhas to be the atmosphere. It was so fun to sit outside and let my baby play on the grass and have room to play. I didn't realize there was a splash pad but I will definitely come back in the summer more prepared! they also have super cute stuff inside to look at and buy like the original Luci's. Love love love!

HOsYtoVYMrecdvEWZj5hRA.text: I love this place for the food and the ambiance. Even when they are busy and kids are running around by the fountain, sitting outside is still a nice experience.   I even enjoy sitting under the trees and listening to the chirping of the birds. It's a little getaway place for me especially after teaching my high impact group fitness class. This is my 'go to' place when I need a quick bite to eat that's fresh and good.   Their little shop inside will certainly keep you entertained and intrigued. They sell some quirky things and gifts.

ZFsbUmq9BMH1xZAedgPnnA.text: I am a college student and this place is amazing especially for studying or doing homework! They have free wifi and the patio is so cute. The food is amazing i love the avocado toast and the juices! 10/10 recommend

L8Y3froRj173qJJRQ_BqKQ.text: Now that I've been here 3 times (twice on consecutive weekends, no less) it's time to add my two cents.  As someone else mentioned, I'm not sure I would have found this place had a friend not mentioned it.  I'm REALLY liking Luci's, from the moment a buddy and I rode our motorcycles here on opening day to this morning's visit with my best friend. Luci's  comprises one of three establishments surrounding a beautiful little courtyard shared by all ( it will be really ideal come the cooler weather! ). Inside the shop are various things to purchase, from knickknacks, jewelry, sundry food items, etc.   I've only come for breakfast so far, but I'm sure the other items are just as tasty. The Morning Run Burrito this morning was just perfect: sauteed kale, black bean mix, sauteed peppers, Swiss cheese and egg whites (I'm quoting from the menu here) in whole wheat tortilla, with a side of salsa. Just delicious. On my previous two early morning visits I chose the Egg sandwich on an "everything" bagel with bacon. You can choose from a variety of cheeses and meat to put in, according to your tastes. It's now a favorite of mine. The coffee is also really tasty. I've enjoyed the Americano and a simple regular coffee. Each time it's been a treat.  As you'd expect there's a generous selection of cream, non-dairy, sweeteners and such to flavor to your taste or not, as well as bottles of Cholula or tabasco sauce to spice up your meal should you so choose  The restaurant is laid out in a basic "L" shape with plenty of seating as well as a few countertop settings, all of which offer a nice view of the courtyard, which also offers a good amount of seating, trees, grass and even a little splash pad that kids can frolic in.   Service has been great each time as well. Food is ordered at the counter and if you want a coffee or drink it's given to you almost before you're done paying. You take a number to your table and in short order your food is brought to you. I seriously don't think I've waited much more than 5 minutes from the time I've sat down to receiving my food. The staff is very friendly, easy with a smile, courteous and seem pleased that you've stopped by.   Overall, Luci's at the Orchard is just a great place. It's definitely earned a high spot on my regular "rotation" of motorcycle meal destinations. I bring a good book, or a good friend and enjoy. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Luci's at the Orchard - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Morning Run Burrito and java. Delicious.

ouwtyAiiAVVALeI-waRVjw.text: Great food always! Because I'm a basic millennial I usually get avocado toast and it's worth every penny/calorie. I've also enjoyed their French toast, pancakes, breakfast burrito, and ice cream, and have never been disappointed. The service is always great, and the shop has so many adorable things (fart books, glitter sunscreen and fairy wands, anyone?). They also have a super-adorable, sugar-filled treat called a Unicorn Milkshake... best to split this $11 drink with at least three friends who are not Keto/paleo/whole 30/ anything that encourages only eating foods with less than 1 million grams of sugar. I can't speak to the taste, but Instagram will thank you.  Also, they have very easy parking, a grassy knoll, and a little splash pad, so this place is perfect for kids.

33aJHEnN4KNDVh6mcmXV-g.text: Nice atmosphere.  Good latte.  Lousy blueberry scone.  Not flaky at all.  Dough is overworked and overbaked and there are about six blueberries. Disappointing.

lTSS4QycwEfS5FVf4wR5hA.text: I love how cute it is in here. The decor is so simple just rustic and good vibe feel. While you wait for your food you're shopping. Haha. I got mints, a bag of chips and a necklace.  The flapjacks with strawberries and blueberries Got chiliciles here. No chicken and bacon please with extra Avocados. Yummmmnn.  The courtyard is so family oriented and full of kids at the slash pad area. They also have tables outside of you want to dine outside.   I love just over love this place! Yummmmm

riA0aAzLU76DpAKJT_L1pg.text: I have a love/hate relationship with this place.  I love the layout and general vibe of the place. The employees I have come in contact with have all been great. I have had the turkey melt, the club (both with the killer potato salad) and the veggie omelet. All the food has been great.  I have been here on a Sunday at noon, a Thursday at 11 and a Saturday at 10:30. Even the Thursday was down to circle the parking lot looking for parking by 11:30. I have trouble recommending this place without mentioning the lack of parking and the chance that you may wait in line to order 20-30 minutes. And when they are that busy you may end up standing to eat.  A solid 3-1/2 stars.

TIsOLrLCw7ATyKi4cCJr-g.text: I love this place!!! This was my first time here and the atmosphere and environment is awesome. Just moved to Phoenix and I will for sure be making this my go-to spot. The service is friendly and the menu is killer!!

nvJ5nyMSAKhS3pxNgriSaw.text: I've been to Luci's marketplace plenty of times before but I went to the orchard for the first time a couple weeks ago. The location is really cool! I like the outdoor area and all of the different sections. A cool place to go when the weather is nice out! I decided to order the veggie burger since that is my favorite thing to get at the marketplace location. I excepted it to be the same, but it wasn't. The one at the orchard just wasn't as good, they use a premade patty, I didn't think they did at the other location but I might be wrong! Was pretty crowded there too and parking was a challenge. But otherwise cool! I'd like to come back!

GbyImIa0lSFglwDG5LfLgg.text: Great meet up place with family and friends. Great food. Fresh new ides for breakfast lunch and dinner. I recommended the traditional breakfast or their pancakes! Wow! Great sandwiches and fruit smoothies! Trendy fun environment.

0CHuG3FsABkPyRIepA9tXA.text: Our 2nd. Sat. breakfast group choose Luci's for our time together this month. It is a very fun, very family friendly place. Great patio seating as well as nice cool inside tables. Lots of fun things to look at and buy. Home made sweets galore. Yum!!  Breakfast was good. Mine a bit over cooked, so  depends on what you order I'm guessing but definatly a place to visit. Fun water feature for kids, bathing suit required. Will I go again? Yes for sure.

higB_x-M8e6SrcJHs0XaZQ.text: I went in this morning left mid meal food was gross half ass cooked I left after being disgusted by the chilaquiles cold af I basically paid 30 dollars for a coffee and smoothie  Dave ur appetite  Don't come here

Food is cooked well but basic. Nothing special, just your average breakfast. Still good enough we'll be back but again, not often.

OEQJJNa8vsYSgfEPF0JE4g.text: fav little place to enjoy an orchard while getting avocado toast and lemonade. They have a lot of options including gluten free breads and toasts as long as you ask. Also adorable for photos. I'm studying to be a journalist and it's just the kind of cute spot that has the right aesthetic to grab your attention (well in my humble opinion) lol

g00V8c8Iwsxcbm13wSPzIg.text: Absolutely adorable! I happened to go during a what looked like a Wedding/Reception being set up. A little overwhelming but totally understandable. Once we parked and headed in everything was so fun. So many details and aspects I feel like I still missed and want to go back and see all the details! Excellent coffee, and food was absolutely incredible! I had an iced white mocha with lavender and coconut milk. I also ordered the avocado toast which was bomb! My boyfriend ordered a cold brew (incredible) and he had a burger- also excellent.   The coffee was truly a highlight for us as we have about 15 years experience combined working with coffee.

yhUPvWrVtft8xsQ3aSakIg.text: Absolutely pleased with Luci's at The Orchard. It's in the smack middle of busy streets! But once you park, walk in, order, sit down, the mood totally transforms into your own personal secret garden. The food is great! Awesome staff, design is beautiful indoors and out. And their ice cream neighbors make it a match made in heaven.  Definitely coming back! Love, peace, more bacon please!

aZZ9CG8zMDAvLU808pdr1w.text: The food itself was okay. My omelette was a little overdone to the point of being a bit rubbery. Mother liked her Spanish omelette. My friend just had a yogurt parfait and said it was okay. Similar fare as Luci's Healthy Marketplace, but I think the other location has better presentation. Here, the interior feels cramped (good thing there is an outside area). The thing they really turned me off was that a server dropped a plate of some red syrupy breakfast stuff on me and my elderly mother. My friend who was with us said he had not been paying attention and let the plate slip right out of his hands. At least it wasn't something searing hot, but it made a huge mess. He kept apologizing but wasn't very quick about cleaning it up, even though it was clearly all over me, mother and the floor. He finally went to get a rag to wipe the floor, but I specifically had to ask him for a wet cloth so I could wipe off the jam or whatever it was from my mother's cashmere sweater (that's going to need a good dry cleaning now) and from me, and from our chairs. He seemed stuck on just repeating, "I'm so sorry," without having the insight that he should be making sure we had what we needed to clean ourselves off and - given the amount of mess, inconvenience and the cost of having to dry clean the sweater, we all agreed that he should have asked the manager to offer some sort of credit back. I wasn't impressed.

92gv2d4hNTvgzraKpn32zg.text: Music inside Luci's on Saturday morning a week and a half ago (11/17) was so loud we could not have a two-person table conversation.   The server turned down the music once at our request however someone else turned it Way Back Up minutes later.  Could not find the manager as we could the first few months the restaurant was open.  Live nearby and have been enjoying this restaurant since it opened and have recommended it to many others.   Suggest Luci's buy a decibel meter and determine a reasonable volume for diners.  The music also was not very easy listening music but could cope if volume down.  We may not be weekly diners anymore if the speaker volume just above the inside tables is not lowered.  The food is always excellent though!  Thanks.

FCGEPfEfhT_JRU2B64aIpA.text: Love this place!! Great atmosphere and even better food. Quick lunchtime service and reasonable prices.

ZlnH1qbg3vnMtUUaSTTN4w.text: This place is amazing. Visiting from out of state and I wish I could pack it up and take it home with me. The atmosphere is what makes it. Wish I could come back regularly!!

ts6VBis0by4qhJwIITBjqQ.text: The seating situation is a challenge on the weekend mornings so get there early. The omelettes were great and so were the coffees and mimosas. We usually go to the other location, so this was a nice change.

F6bpwqCFsJ4MH194EqZkbA.text: What a great place to order great food and sit outside in the beautiful Arizona weather.  Listen to the birds sing and relax with wonderful breakfast or lunch.

PB--PhB0dK-Z4kzpE4HQGg.text: The breakfast burritos there are really tasty, I get mine with no meat and extra eggs! The house salsa that it comes with is fresh and a great add on, I just wish it had a little more kick to it! I could eat one every day! The coffee was a little burnt which was a downfall for me- as I went there to work one day and any workday without coffee isn't great! I've also tried their French toast and omelettes and I've never been disappointed!

Iuqcgz-59Dip1-hCr63c2A.text: Love this place. From sweet finds while in line to a large menu that sells itself. It's such an oasis in the middle of the city.

XLOkoQvACQQyRA23kYDREA.text: Being a fan of Luci's at 16th and Bethany I really hate to put this place down but the last two visits have been way below expectations.   Lunch a week ago was just OK as far as the food but we attempted to eat on the back patio near the kiddie fountain and were overcome by flies!! It was gross. Note to Luci, Bottle Trees or plastic bags with water in them. (It works look it up)  Went again for brunch today. More flies though not as bad as a week ago. Breakfast was tasteless. The Carmel Almond Fruit tea and the Smuckers jam were the highlights of the visit.  Not sure whats wrong here but it definitely needs work before I will be returning.

7CsKZ2O9srXrLxXZQpzTPw.text: What is more dangerous than brunch? Being able to shop for gifts and wine at Brunch. I love love love Luci's. I have to say that it took way too long for me to finally make my way over, but it was worth the wait. The employee's are incredibly knowledgeable about the menu from the coffee to the food being served. I absolutely love that you can substitute avocado for meat at breakfast. Little things like that definitely set them apart. This is a great place to meet up with a friend or family, though it can get a little too noisy with children.

3T5rAQRSqMMelPnVwctLow.text: What a great place! The atmosphere is great both inside and out. Try to go at the least busiest times as the place gets unbelievably packed making it hard to park and find a place to eat. Having only been there once, I cannot give advice on what times are best, but I can tell you that 11 am on a Sunday is busy! Next time I will probably try 8:00-8:30 am to beat the brunch crowd.   Feel fee to bring the kids to play on splash pad, grassy area and share some ice cream, which looked delicious. There is a fresh lemonade stand and I noticed that a kinds Birthday party was going on while we were there. I will add a caveat, if you are a person that does not have toleration for children this place may be difficult for you. Because of the great amenities that I mentioned above there are a lot children here.   In regards to food and beverage selection, there is way more than I thought there would be. The green tea was delicious and they have a nice array adult beverages as well as coffee choices. The food was great and since I am a picky eater they were super accommodating.  Overall, awesome place! I will just try to find a less busy time to go.

Of course, we went very early on a weekend, so I'm not sure how crowded or trendy this is.  Only drawback is that it's kind of pricey - especially the coffees.  I've bought myself a lot of iced mochas and this was the most I've ever paid.  The iced brew wasn't much cheaper.
